Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Needs Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: poleinahole1
Reviews.Content: I got a great Internet rate that included Internet and breakfast and was happy for what I paid. However, I would have been very disappointed had I paid the rate they normally want for a superio gueen room. My room was tiny, furnture and decor was old and tired not just in my room but throughout the hotel. Nice flatscreen TV and blazingly fast Internet service (normally costs $12.95 a day) were a plus. Hairdryer was such poor quality it barely dried my hair (which is very short). My room overlooked the next door building bt was very quiet. I slept very well. Service was also old and tired with a few exceptions such as the super maitre d'hotel in the restaurant who cheerfully seats the throngs that line up for breakfast after 9 AM with aplomb. The table I was show to still had crumbs, half used butter and milk on it from the previous guests and was not removed durig the whole time I sat there., I had to constantly ask the waiters for water refills and to stock fruit and other missing items from the buffet. Location of the restaurant overlooking Central Park is gorgeous if you can snag a window seat. If not, you can eat at many of the neighboring cafes which will probably provide a bettter experience. Free breakfast buffet includes Danish and fruits. If you want cereal, eggs, porridge, etc. you pay a surcharge. They have an excellent 24 hour gym with state of the art equipment. It gets very busy though. Note that if you need to store luggage, they charge $20 per bar, per night! I won't stay here next time in NYC. Try the Michelangelo a few blocks south. (See my review.),

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Montrealais058
Reviews.Content: As they say, location, location, location is the key. Situated right on the south border of Central Park, the Park Lane is perfectly located to explore Midtown New York on foot and, on top, there are two subway stations within a block from the hotel. Our room had two double beds and was huge by New York City standards; the beds were comfortable. The view (we were facing Central park) was fantastic, especially at dusk. Although very clean, the bathroom would have needed to be updated. Continental breakfast was included in the price of our room. Selection of food was somewhat limited and it would have been nice if there had been more choice, like cereals and yogurt. Service for breakfast was just ok; the maitre d' at the breakfast room was somewhat sourly. A smile on his part would have been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: danieljlawton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2012 for 4 nights. The Helmsley Park Lane is a very nice hotel in a fantastic location. It is next to Central Park (South) and has very easy links to anywhere in the City. There is a tube station next to the hotel as well as bus tops (including the stop for sightseeing tours). The horse and carriages that do tours of the park are also on the same road as the hotel. If you don't want to use public transport then you can just walk straight down 5th Avenue. Our room was great, we had a huge (very comfortable) bed, a nice bathroom (with good shower) and lots of storage space. I had asked for a park view room (if possible) when booking it but we didn't get one which was disappointing as it was a special treat for my fiancee's 30th birthday. To be fair they did offer us an upgrade when we checked in but at $100 per night we couldn't afford it unfortunately. The only downside to this hotel is the prices of extras. We booked as a package with American Sky so got a good deal on the room rates, however the cost of breakfast and the bar was completely unrealistic. We only had one drink in the bar as we didn't realise how expensive it was until after we had asked for the bill. The mini bar is the same, we often fancied a drink whilst getting ready but at those prices we waited until we were out. Don't let this put you off though. It is a great hotel in a brilliant location and it's surrounded by some of the most famous (and most expensive) hotels in NYC. The extras are therefore expensive for a reason, but just be careful. I would strongly recommend this hotel if you are planning on a short trip to New York and need a nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: larawankenobi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Helmsley during March 2012 over the St Patrick’s Day weekend. The room was advertised as two “double” beds. The beds were narrower than expected, not nearly as large as UK style “double” beds. Continental breakfast was included in the price. However, when we arrived at the dining room we were advised that although there were four people staying in our room, only two breakfasts were included. At $30 per person, the cost of paying for extra continental breakfasts was exorbitant. For the quality of this hotel (Four Stars), the continental breakfast was disappointing. Hot drinks, juice, bagels, muffins, toast and fruit were all that was included. Groups must also wait to be seated for breakfast, which appears to be a very slow process. Some of the rooms in the hotel have an excellent view over Central Park. Some of the rooms have also been recently refurbished. Not all of the rooms are of the same standard. We were impressed by the security in the lobby. We arrived back at our room sometimes very late at night. There were always security staff in the elevator lobby checking that only hotel guests gained access to the rooms. The location of the hotel is excellent, just on the edge of Central Park. The concierge and bell staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful beautiful beautiful”
Reviews.Author: sven v
Reviews.Content: great hotel with a magnificent view. great clean rooms with a lot of space.

Reviews.Title: “What a location, what a view !!”
Reviews.Author: TravelSnoopy
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in a Executive Park View Junior Suite on the 44th floor. The view was just spectacular. The skyline of Upper West Side on your left, Upper East Side on your right, and the fantastic Central Park in the middle. Any time of the day it is just a feast for for your eyes. The hotel is a real "Classic" though and I think they should definitely invest in it. Especially the bathroom was dated and should be renovated. The bed and furniture was fine. But still, if it is a special deal on the room rate, I can recommend it for the view and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Bedford555”
Reviews.Author: E B
Reviews.Content: + Great location + Nice helpful staff + Lovely rooms (2 booked) - Internet access in each room $10 per 24 hours - too expensive - No tea making facilities in room. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “One of the best locations in NYC. Nice hotel. Rooms are dated, though.”
Reviews.Author: A_OKD
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (2 adults and 3 teenage boys) stayed at the Park Lane hotel during March Break 2012 from Saturday to Thursday. We had booked the Junior Executive Suite with another adjoining room on one of the Executive Floors at a 50% discount. I believe the normal rate for this arrangement is well-over $1,000 per night. This gave us two bedrooms with a king size bed each, a large living room, three full bathrooms and six closets. Hence, space was not a problem for us. We were on the 36th floor with one bedroom and the living room looking out directly onto Central Park while the second bedroom looked out onto 58th. The view of Central Park was absolutely worth the price. One can see north to the park, the Upper East and Upper West sides very clearly. We found the rooms to be very spacious, the king-sized beds and the one roll-away bed ($35 dollars extra per night) to be very new and comfortable. The furniture was dated but clean and in good repair. The bathrooms were dated but very functional and clean. The toiletries supplied by the hotel was Gilchrist and Soames. The towels were not the "fluffiest" and one did have a hole on it -- this is an issue that other reviewers have pointed out. Being on the Executive Floor had some perks. These were: Continental Breakfast for 2 included each day (value of about $40 total each day), 2 drinks at Harry's Bar (value of about $40 total per day; the price of drinks at the hotel is high). The breakfast could be eaten at either the one restaurant on the 2nd floor or in your room via room service. Service was just fine (I would rate it 7 out of 10). If you are expecting a Four Seasons level of customer service then you will be disappointed. The fitness facility was sizeable with an array of Cybex machines, some free weights, one Smith machine, two treadmills, one stationary bike and one step climber. However, we found it could have used a cleaning. The Park Lane is close to the following subway lines: N, Q and R - entrance on 59th just east of the hotel; A, B, C, E, 1, 2 and 3 at Columbus Circle and further East the number 6 near Lexington and 59th. We would definitely stay at this hotel in the future but couldn't imagine paying the full price for the rooms. Our overall impression is that the hotel has seen better days (probably when Leona Helmsley was still running it) but its location makes it a good "value" if one is able to receive a discount.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: maria-xristos
Reviews.Content: We had the winter special 50% off plus continental breakfast, so we didn't pay much for the room. We had the King room Central Park view which was amazing, still I think it would not be overpriced if we payed for the full amount, only for the location and view. If you do not get a Park view, you should consider other hotels in NYC that have city views and the rooms are in better condition. It definatelly needs renovation, but then the price would be like 5 times what we payed. The furniture was old but the room was very clean and in a decent condition. The breakfast was nothing but fruit and muffins, I would be furious if I had to pay the 27 $ per person.The location is perfect, very safe, we could easilly walk around in the night after we went to clubs and bars, and there are perfect restaurants around, hot spot clubs and bars, we never even got the sub, we only took taxi a couple of times as I was very tired .I would stay there again, hopefully soon, and only at a Park view room.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Marianne4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding. From the view on central park, the big windows in the breakfast room with view on central park, the room clean, well decorated and fresh, the bed perfect and no noise as if we were in the country side, to the staff incredibly friendly and perfectly professional. Nothing was missing for our joy. .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: Xtelle
Reviews.Content: An old amazing hotel. The service is great, very big rooms, awesome views and perfect location. I totally recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Aging but still the Queen of Park Lane”
Reviews.Author: namrun14
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay mid-February for four days. We used to stay here often 10 years ago but had not done so in the last five years. Spacious rooms overlooking the Central Park, excellent service all around and very central location for all our interests reminded us what we have missed lately. Yes, the rooms and technologies may not at par with more modern hotels but at least for us, the above mentioned qualities definitely outweigh these minor concerns!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great view of Central Park”
Reviews.Author: shoppingNY
Reviews.Content: Location is great. Would require refurbishing, specially bathroom. In room pay per view would have been nice., as well as coffe maker. Be aware of mini-bar, in you remove an item to place your own bottle of water, or soft drink, you will automatically be charged, as all item are scanned. No complimentary wi-fi in lobby, or room.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Warmth Package Well Worthwhile!”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond20
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic and I booked two rooms for four people. I requested the same floor if possible at the time I reserved (on the hotel's own site) and followed up with a phone call a week later. The reservations agents seemed to think this was a ridiculous request and, I think, made no effort whatsoever to honor it. We checked in at 1.30 and neither room was available (which was OK with a scheduled 3pm check in). In fact our second room didn't become available until after 6pm. The check-in desk is a weak spot in the hotel. A couple of agents (Tom and an eastern European accented woman) were pleasant and helpful in mid-afternoon but by evening it was being run by the rejects from Fawlty Towers! Frustrated travelers were being given rooms with no cribs, no connecting doors and no whatever else they requested. This wasn't too serious for my family with teenagers but a very upset French family were being given a "fabulous King suite" (with one bed) instead of the interconnecting rooms with four beds total that they had requested. The father was nearly in tears after a transatlantic flight with three children under age 9. It seems very odd in view of the fact that both of the rooms we eventually got had connecting doors (locked, thankfully!) to other rooms. And the staff clearly couldn't have cared less. The hotel is nice in a 1990s way. It's comfortable and the beds were good. I paid $40 more for a Central Park View suite (just a slightly bigger room) and it was more recently decorated than the "double double" which was still quite good for the kids. Continental breakfast was included in this package deal and was served in our rooms which was lovely. We could have gone to the dining room but we had our own lovely view of Central Park from the 9th and 10th floors. All in all this package was reasonable value and it cost about $330 per room per night with breakfast for two. Internet wasn't included. The hotel is certainly a bit dated. The room service and housekeeping staff were very good indeed but the front desk is not good enough quite a lot of the time. I would not stay here at a higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!!”
Reviews.Author: carolynvm
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best locations in NYC. Beautiful hotel overlooking Central Park. Convenient walking distance to everything in midtown. Nice rooms and friendly staff. We booked using a winter promo code offered on their website, so it was even reasonably priced for a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Great views from the old grand Dame”
Reviews.Author: CookieRoxy
Reviews.Content: Five nights in February 2012 at this well-known hotel with a great view of the whole park was good enough reason to give a good review. The large room, with a pricey upgrade, was fine but the bathroom was not refurbished as promised and the room amenities were of yesteryear...not complaining but not as promised, however it did indeed remind of the scandalous stories that occurred a few decades ago...! The breakfast included in the upgrade was certainly not up to international standards but the dining room is splendid looking over the park from the 2nd floor. Aside from the bar and restaurant good service, the rest of the hotel staff were not making much effort to make our long term stay more friendly, even when a flea was found in the sheets!....not a bed bug but a flea which could have come from anywhere,,,even from outside the window of the 39th floor in the middle of winter...really general manager?...really?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy_Daley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Helmsley Park Lane recently for a getaway weekend just before Valentine's Day. Excellent location directly across from the park, easy walking distance to Times Square, MoMa, the Natural History Museum, and very close to the subway. We got hit up by the pedicab and hansom cab drivers every time we walked out the door, but they were easy to say 'no thank you' to. We booked a Junior Suite and when we checked in, found we had been upgraded to an Executive Suite on the 43rd floor. We had a view of the city, the park, and could see the river - in addition, we had 2 full bathrooms and more room than I've ever had in a NYC hotel. The room (really, rooms - 2 adjoining, 4310 & 4311) was gorgeous but now I'm spoiled. :) We walked everywhere, from Times Square down to the Penn Station area and back. Our room came with the buffet breakfast, and it was very nice to do room service. They bring a very nice table to your room and set everything up. Hotel breakfast is expensive if you don't have a package, but there's a little place around the corner on 6th (Angela's Rock & Roll Deli) that has a no-frills $6 breakfast and a few tables to sit down at if you just want something quick & inexpensive. Bed was very comfortable, and the showers were great - lots of hot water and good water pressure. This is definitely a hotel we will come back to.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff”
Reviews.Author: eurichard
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during 4 days and in everytime the staff was rude even I've given good tips. ItÂ´s a good hotel and excelent location but I don't recomend !!

Reviews.Title: “Opposite Central Park”
Reviews.Author: butterfly200016
Reviews.Content: The room was to a good standard and spacious. The overall feel of the hotel made us feel special. The man who checked us in chatted with us about where we came from, even naming bands he knew of from our region! The concierge were also very helpful, in fact all staff were very professional. It is opposite Central Park and whilst this meant a bit of a walk to Times Square, it didn't take us long and meant we probably saw more of Central Park then we would have done.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - and staff too!”
Reviews.Author: Rogern5
Reviews.Content: After having read reviews here ( mostly the negative ones) I must say that we were in for a really pleasant surprise! We felt very welcome at once - the staff; Doorman - receptionists - concierges all were polite and welcoming at our arrival and during our whole stay ( stayed for one week.) We had a prepaid "Deluxe Queen room with City View". A very nice room, clean, and stayed clean every day during our stay. We asked for a room higt up, ad got one on floor 23. OK wiew, no traffic noise. Lovely breakfast restaurant. - breakfast being served from 07.00 - 1130. Continental buffet was included in the prepaid price - (consisted of sliced fruits, bagels, croissants and assorted cakes (!!) cream cheese an jam / jelly. (A bit different an scarce compared to European hotel buffets, but any way.. it was OK) New York is a very expensive city. So was the breakfast menu in our hotel (Tried it once - 20 Dollars for one portion of pancakes..). Best location ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great location across from Central Park with subway out the door”
Reviews.Author: hkh60
Reviews.Content: Nice old style hotel. Amazing location on the south edge of Central Park. Subway access just out the door across the street and two doors down. Good beds and pillows. Good views of either the city or Central Park. Maid service was exceptional. Lots of staff in the lobby....not very attentive other than the concierge. The Reception staff and the many staff members hanging out in the lobby need to figure out they are there to serve the customer not chat with each other. I wonder where the manager is?? The restaurant looks over Central Park in a lovely room. Nice continental breakfast with lovely fresh fruit and pastries. Lots of wait staff....not very attentive. I wonder where the manager is?? We had problems with the door locks and had to have security visit several times in the five days that we stayed there to open our door and to "work on the lock". When revisiting Reception to get new keys they were not friendly. One time they gave us new keys without checking IDs!! Security was always pleasant when they came up to fix the lock, but it is annoying to have to go downstairs several times each time the key does not work to get someone to come and fix the faulty locks. I wonder where the manager is?? Overall I would say they need to do some updating but it is a lovely old hotel with class. Management needs to beef up expectations for being customer friendly. Because of the location I would consider staying there again if the rates are good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel across from Central Park!”
Reviews.Author: mma80
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Helmsley. The bed was super comfortable and the pillows were perfect. The staff was very helpful. We were hoping to relax in a hot tub but there wasn't one. That was probably the biggest downfall for us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Central Park view! Large rooms. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: RoseTraveller
Reviews.Content: Pleasant stay at Park Lane in a Central Park view. Very large, elegant and comfortable room with various cabinets to keep all the lugagge out of the way. And, of course, the location on Park South is just outstanding. Breakfasy selection needs improvement. Nice staff compensates the lack of variety. My husband and I just loved it and will pick this hotel again whenver possible on our future trips to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Where's the management ???”
Reviews.Author: Michaelskid7
Reviews.Content: First off I would like to state that I should have check on trip advisor before booking yet another room at this shipwreck of a hotel. My first experience at the Helmsley was horrendous but I thought to give it a second chance for I believed this time around what could go wrong. My first surprise was that they have cut down on staff, to a point where service is non existent. You have to wait 15 mins at the front desk to be greeted by a tired, rude agent p. who has no clue of whats going on. U was attended by a blind rude woman, whom claimed to be a manager, how she became a manager blows my mind. She was rude, inconsiderate and pushy. I had booked a room on Expedia where it stated on my reservation included breakfast, even though I had the documents I was still denied breakfast which I end up paying over 35 dollars for trash, yuck ! On the second night my shabby room was way too hot, the arrogant over night manager cont. to tell me that they would send an engineer I waited over45 mins no one ever came and when I called the last time I was told to open a window to cold down the room .... Are they serious ??!?!!!! Over all I would never step foot back in this hotel & I blame the management. The most Logical reason I could think of is that they cut all the service oriented staff and left a hotel full of old, tired, run down staff. A staff matches the service terrible !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sarah l
Reviews.Content: I liked staying at the Helmsley Park Lane and my room was absolutely fine, not dilapidated at all as some others have said . I suppose rooms in these big hotels get refurbed in batches and so getting a good room is a bit hit and miss. Liked the dining room with view of Central Park .Nice breakfast buffet, but also lots of nearby places to have breakfast too e.g.: SaraBeths. Was a bit miffed to be charged $10 a day for using the internet on my iPhone ( very briefly) - there was no warning if the charge - it just asked you for your room number. Mentioned it to the receptionist on checkout and the charge was removed . They have an IT room where you can check in online for your flight and get your plane e-ticket printed out, but you have to pay for that. Overall, the location does it for me. Hotels in New York are pricey and I usually stay at The Wellington , but got a good price on the Helmsley .

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Lady in a Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: JillySAustralia
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location. The Helmsley is hard to beat. The rooms are very spacious and very comfortable. Make sure you book a park view room preferably on floors 30 or above. Although tired the bathrooms are clean and adequate. Staff are courteous and the dining room, although a bit shabby has great views also. It is the perfect place for an extended stay with massive views providing unsurpassed views of the Park. The underground is two doors down and the Metropolitan Museum, Times Square, 5th Avenue, Lexington are all just around the corner. Best deals appear to be from on-line booking agencies rather than the hotel itself although we were advised it is worth comparing both. A great place to use as a base for visiting New York and the Park is just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: TNTGL
Reviews.Content: The view we had from the 33rd floor overlooking Central Park was 5 star, but the room, unrenovated and showing its age, was at best 2 stars (and that's for $600 a night). Old pink wallpaper that was peeling in the bathroom. A mini-refrigerator, also in the bathroom under the vanity (sort of like you'd find in a Route 66 motel). White gilded furniture that Leona H probably thought was tasteful in the 1970's but would be hard to sell at a garage sale. The dining room overlooking the park looked like it hadn't been redone since the 1950's - all dim lighting and faded rugs - and service was terrible. We sat down for breakfast - no silverware. Then they brought knife and fork, but no spoons. No sugar. No juice. On the plus side, it was a family member's birthday, and they brought a lovely chocolate cake and petit fours to the room with a nice note from the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JF8150
Reviews.Content: We spent a week with the kids in NYC, The location was a good choice. The kidâ€™s room could sleep 4. They have a deal for $200 per room plus tax and it is worth no more. The rooms are clean and comfortable and if you are lucky to get a high floor with a park view or if you can afford the extra charge, donâ€™t miss it. The rooms definitely need renovation. The location is best for Central Park and Fifth Avenue. The service is good and the staff was very friendly. Would be nice to have a coffee machine in the room. Donâ€™t waste money on the hotel breakfast. There is a Sarabethâ€™s next door, or if you can walk 2 blocks, donâ€™t miss having breakfast at Le Pain Quotidien on 58th and 7th.

Reviews.Title: “Old world class - great holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: SLRC
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location on central park. The hotel was decorated for the holidays and was very elegant. The upgraded room my husband received was spacious and comfortable with a king bed (he had arrived on initially on business and I arrived later to take advantage of New York during the holidays. The only issue we had with the room was the heat level. Despite turning down the thermostat, the heat remained in the 70's. Staff made an effort to fix once, but it only lasted one evening. The restaurant has a beautiful view of central park. The food is good, the staff friendly, however if it is very busy, they have a difficult time keeping up.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Be Wary!”
Reviews.Author: lesmad
Reviews.Content: My husband booked us into a Park View room at the Helmsley Park Lane (and paid in advance) for an important Birthday. He contacted them in advance to say when we would arrive so our room would be reserved and he requested a bottle of wine on our arrival. When we arrived we were given a subpar room (a large area broken and with rusted surface around the bathtub drain, no park view), that the manager insisted had just been renovated. We complained and after a considerable amount of arguing were finally put in a large room with a park view the next day, but also after being told two different stories, the first being that they would move our things to the new room while we were out, and the other that we had to be there while they moved our things, meaning we would be stuck in the hotel at 3pm (the middle of our day in NY!) That morning we had a terrible experience at the continental breakfast. The manager, who did apologize later, seated us after a long wait (getting us dangerously close to cut off time) and then it took four additional requests (I had to get up and find someone as no one would approach us) for me to get a pot of black tea, which was the very first thing I requested to our server when we were seated. To be fair, once we argued and complained (an unpleasant thing to have to do on your birthday!) we were moved to a beautiful room with a magnificent view, and treated to cake and champagne, although they tried to charge us for these "gifts of apology" when we checked out as "room service". The place has some beautiful rooms, with wonderful views but frankly, the management seems to be a mess. If you book, talk to the manager first, check in early to get the room you pay for, go to the continental breakfast early to get any food or drink, and check your bill carefully. If all of these things go smoothly, you might have a stay to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Dame with lots of Character”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the obvious, a view of Central Park. Travelling off-season, I found a great rate for a Junior Suite Park view. When I checked in, the hotel staff looked for the highest available floor without my request...off to a good start! The bellmen and staff make you feel like a regular with their genuine warmth and eagerness to please. The way things work here is you can ask for nearly anything and the staff will go out of their way to accomodate you. Also many extras are included in standard pricing so you won't get nickel and dimed for extras. The only reason I didn't give it a fifth star is because it is just a bit older, so you have to turn on the lights individually, etc., and the hotels I rated 5 stars were technologically impressive. But I loved my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “new york break”
Reviews.Author: stevewen Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent location on central park, not far to walk to the shops & times square, the staff were very friendly & helpful, the hotel was lovely & clean, the restaurant has a great outlook over the park, a lovely way to start the day with breakfast. T he bar & staff was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenniYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in December for a supise birthday treat. Room available early for check in which was a huge bonus after a flight from UK. Large room with a good view of the city and the park ( although descibed as a city view room). Great location on central park south. Rooms a bit tired looking altough clean and pleasant. All staff encountered were freindly and efficient. A birthday was in the room on our return from a day out which was a nice touch. On the whole decent hotel, not luxurious but would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A bad remake of 1970s NYC”
Reviews.Author: RalphGeorge
Reviews.Content: The Helmsley's lack of service and it's repair standard is a replay of the stereotypes of 1970s New York - arrogant while in a state of decay and denial. The doormen don't open doors for luggage-laden guests. The front desk clerk denies the room rate includes breakfast, as promised by Expedia; the guest is required to email the hotel manager with proof of Expedia's offer, and the manager does not reply. A guest is woken in the wee predawn hours by the noxious odor of smoking, although a non-smoking floor is guaranteed in the rate and the guest requested at check-in to be far from any smoking floors; in fact, the smoking floor is one below and no attempt is made to creat a vapor barrier. The night manager is haughty and disdainful that the guest is upset about being denied a night's sleep. "It's not the hotel's fault you've been woken up," says Mr. Velasquez, the night manger. He refuses any kind of financial compensation for the hotel's failure to deliver the basic quid pro quo of a decent night's sleep. He reluctantly offers a new room, but it takes 25 minutes for such to be arranged, and then the new room keys delivered do not work. I have traveled the world on business, for three decades, and frequently to New York. The Helmsley Park Lane is easily the worst hotel experience I've had.

Reviews.Title: “My got-to New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDSunkel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Helmsley Park Lane 3 times now. The rooms need to be renovated, but they are comfortable and well-appointed (just old). What keeps me coming back is the incredible location (a fantastic area directly across from Central Park) and the incredible service. Their in-hotel restaurant is fabulous for breakfast, the service can't be beat there.

Reviews.Title: “for me the best hotel i have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: buddy070
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, the staff were attentive and went the extra mile The hotel is smaller than others i have stayed in so you were able to get the lifts at all times, i never had to wait... Excellent Sunnday brunch with a jazz band and the restaurant looks over Central Park. I was there in June and it was incredibly hot but the hotel was always very comfortable air wise Very close to the shopping and entertainment, i aim to return..

Reviews.Title: “They should be thankful they're locating where they are.”
Reviews.Author: Youwannaknowthis
Reviews.Content: If you like rude front of house staff who have no idea how to answer anything from a parking question to a "good place to eat" question (which I'M CERTAIN they should know) and getting a "deluxe city view" which actually look onto a parking lot, then this is the place for you! The location is the only thing that saves it and everyone there sort of lets you know that.

Reviews.Title: “If You Can Get a Deal, Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: MattB
Reviews.Content: We got an internet deal for about $350/night. Well worth it at that price. A few doors down from the Ritz Carlton- essentially the same location on Central Park South. Reasonable amenities. Could use a coffee set up in the morning. About a half dozen bored, retired or off duty cops are always strolling the lobbey, which is good, I suppose. Great location, good sized rooms. Not the height of luxury, but very satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Location for a short holiday in New York”
Reviews.Author: LadyMolestrangler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our Around the World trip. The Park Lane has a wonderful location directly in front of the south of Central Park; close to the Metro; Fifth Avenue and the Avenue of the Americas. It was an excellent base for our sightseeing. The hotel was always busy both in the reception areas but we found the staff to be both friendly and very helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable with adequate space. Its decor was rather dark being decorated in 1980's fashion. We only used Harry's Bar once finding it uncomfortable and a little expensive. Likewise we used the neighbouring restaurants for breakfast as we considered the Park Lane costly. The neighbouring Sarabeth's is an alternative with an interesting menu but also expensive.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Park Lane”
Reviews.Author: IATraveler65
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in September at the Park Lane Hotel. Our room was huge - especially for New York. Even though we had a city view room, we also had a magnificent view of Central Park. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The location is great - within easy walking distance of 3 subway lines. We often stay in different hotels in New York, but we intend to go back to the Park Lane.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: TLVdude
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over 20 times as it is the company hotel. REally love it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely doorman, fantastic location, dated decor”
Reviews.Author: Dinah93
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. The location was excellent, being close to several metro lines, and being right on central park. Our room was to the rear of the hotel, but was fairly quiet being high up. The hotel was very clean, but it is quite dated in terms of dÃ©cor with fussy mock-French furniture and brass mirrored ceilings. The room was very spacious which surprised me as I'd been expecting a New York broom cupboard. The bedding was all clean and white though which was nice. Our cleaners did a great job, and picked up on the fact I had a cold and left me some spare boxes of tissues which I found thoughtful. The concierge was a bit hard to get hold of, and the front desk staff a bit rushed. Overall we didn't have any problems with the hotel, and would consider it again, but it could really do with some less 1980s dÃ©cor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: debby5828
Reviews.Content: On our trips to New York City for client meetings we have always stayed at this hotel. The location is perfect for us and we love the view of Central Park. This year because of tis past weekend being so close to Christmas it was indeed very busy. As we had breakfast included in our rate (roomservice or the dinning room) we ordered room service. We were told it would be "up right away" an hour later the coffee arrived but no breakfast. Then a half hour later the breakfast came. However there were no knives so we buttered our toast with our spoons. The next morning we decided we would go to the dinning room. The wait to be seated was onerous with vacated tables in sight. It took almost

Reviews.Title: “Just Location and View”
Reviews.Author: EduardoPeixoto
Reviews.Content: If you are looking service, it would be better to choose another hotel. Fantastic location, the view (if you book park view room), nothing more. Two months ago, I booked a park view room had payed in advance. On arrival, they told my wife (she was travelling with my children) that they did not have park view room available (paying in advance). After I contacted them from Brasil trying to give some support to my family, they changed the room. Why only after my phone call the room appeared? Do not pay for the breakfast. They provide only juice, some cakes and bread. It is a joke and I will not spend my time describing the waiters. As usual, we returned to NYC to the Christmas and I have had a lot of problems regarding the service. But I think that it is really my fault. If I decided to return after received that "fantastic" service last october, I can not complain about that.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, helpfull concierge,shame the rest let it down”
Reviews.Author: jcb08121995
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend, at this hotel a birthday treat for my daughter for her 16th birthday. We stayed in a family room with my neice and her daughter also. The location was great, I especially liked being able to access the North and South Grayline tours just outside the door. Anthony the conceierge was particularly helpful and informative. We had really comfy beds and pillows unfortunately the beds were smaller than had been booked. I was stunned by the complete lack of tea making facilities, and over $29 for tea for four was ridiculous. The staff at breakfast were inattentive and slow, they only had to sort the tea and coffee orders and for two days out of the four we stayed the drinks order had to be chased, thank god the view was good I had to organise to post a parcel back to UK and asked at reception to borrow a pair of scissors only to be refused !!! Helpful not..... Rubbish customer service I would think twice before returning

Reviews.Title: “Convenient business hub. Old fashioned, but not out of date”
Reviews.Author: venustar82
Reviews.Content: I am a native New Yorker, so staying in hotels in New York is novel to me. Many are as small and expensive as I remember my apartment being. I got a good rate at the Helmsley Park lane and found it to be a decent value for the size. If I had to pay double, my review might very well have a different tone. The rooms, particularly bathroom, were a bit dated, but it did not detract from the comfort. I may have gotten lucky, but I did not find my room nor the hotel as a whole in the state of disrepair described in some reviews. My biggest complaint was probably the poor quality of the gym, but they probably count on the committed athletes using Central Park right across the street. When it rains, as it did for my stay, I would recommend trying one of the core fusion or yoga classes at the nearby Exhale Spa. The location near 5th avenue and Central Park South is quite convenient for meetings on Park Avenue, and the entrance to the N/R subway is directly under the hotel to access other parts of the city. Because it is a large hotel, it can take some time to get a taxi during checkout and I found it easier to walk a few blocks away and hail one myself.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKA_10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel on business. It is in a perfect location, right on Central Park, close to 5th avenue shopping. Unfortunately other than a gorgeous lobby the rest of the hotel is extremely disappointing. The room was not as clean as I would have liked and was very old and run down. The wallpaper was peeling off the walls, carpet was stained and there was a huge rip in the chair. The bathroom was the worst. A leaky faucet and a tub that filled with water when you took a shower. Please choose another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “It was New York?”
Reviews.Author: diame
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online and the only good thing about it is the location. The service was terrible (room service) for breakfast...took over an hour. The room is old and dreary and the bathroom is pathetic. Hard to believe it was NY!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Poorly Managed”
Reviews.Author: Licorice1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the location on Central Park for a one night stay to enjoy Christmas in New York. We arrived early (9am) and checked in and we were told that our room with 2 double beds would be ready in a couple of hours. The lobby was beautifully decorated. We returned at 4:30 and we were offered an upgrade for an additional $50, which we declined. The clerk told us it would be another 45 min. wait for our room. I explained that we were tired and he offered us 1 double bed and a rollaway for my 12 year old daughter along breakfast in the morning. The room was clean, beautiful with a comfortable bed and crisp white sheets. Unfortunately, the rollaway bed never arrived. After we returned back to the room at 11:15pm, my husband went back down to the lobby to inquire about the bed. Another phone call and 45 min. later a bed arrived- a box spring with a mattress pad and sheets- and no apologies. We had breakfast in the hotel the next morning- again, a beautiful room, beautifully decorated. The continental breakfast was pathetic (people were walking out) and the service was poor- we never saw our waiter after we placed our order. We served ourselves coffee and juice from the waiter's station. We were very disappointed. This hotel is in a perfect location. It was clean and beautiful. It is really too bad that it is managed so poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Park Lane Helmsley!”
Reviews.Author: Perkyworks
Reviews.Content: While waiting for our room we accidentally fell asleep in the lobby as we were exhausted from our redeye fight. We were told to leave. Apparently we weren't "good" enough for them. Well we were good enough for the Ritz Carlton since that is where we checked in and they know how to treat a guest. Shame on you Park Lane! Very poor service!

Reviews.Title: “Suffocating heat then bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 nights at the Helmsley Parl Lane. We entered to a 78 degree room, the AC didn't work and when we checked with the desk they said they would send an engineer, he never showed so we opened the windows to cool the room, we tried to sleep through the sirens and beeping, backing trucks. The next to last day my wife hada welt and said she thought she had a bite. I laughed it off untill the next day she had several welts and was itching with much discomfort. When brought to the attention of the front desk they agreed it was a bedbug bite and said they would quarantine the room. They offered a $50 discount against a $900+ 2 night room bill. What a joke!. We will always check Tripadvisor or bedbug notices before we book in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Old school feel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights here in Nov 2011. Hotel is in a great location and is handy for the subway and (obviously) the park. We got a great deal so can't complain about the price. Didn't eat breakfast so can't comment on the food. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Room was a nice size and well appointed. Cleaned well. I don't ask for much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Probably seen better days”
Reviews.Author: journalistOslo
Reviews.Content: The positive: A beautiful room with classy furniture. Very clean and quiet. The location - Central Park, 5th. Avenue, Carnegie Hall in walking distance. Harrys Bar made the best dry martini ever. The negative: A receptionist trying to sell you a more expensive room. The outrageous breakfast price. A concierge and other phones "never" being answered. Unfriendly approach by the people working in the lobby.With one exception, the staff seemed more interested in their fellow employees than in their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every minute!”
Reviews.Author: liselandry
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I stayed there for our first trip to NYC. The location of the hotel was excellent. We were able to walk almost everywhere. The staff was super friendly and helpful (especially in helping us with directions). The room was beautiful and superclean. The food was excellent. The breakfast that was delivered to our room each morning was excellent. The lobby and main public areas were beautifully decorated and the security was topnotch because we always felt safe there. If I ever go back to NYC, I would 100% stay there again and would recommend anyone I know to as well.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Luxury Hotel Not Suitable for Business - Some rooms have great view of Central Park, Though”
Reviews.Author: timeliebe
Reviews.Content: Since my wife travels a lot on business, we've stayed at a number of hotels on her publisher's dime. Lately when she has to stay in NYC, they put her up at the Helmsley Park Lane, right off Central Park. If you get the right rooms, it has a lovely view of Central Park right out of the movies - and while the current room service menu is EXTREMELY limited (a single laminated tabloid-sized front&back sheet), the food when you get it is generally warm and quite tasty. As with most NYC hotels and restaurants, service staff expect to be tipped fairly generously (we generally give $2/bag to the bellman, $3 to the doorman, $5/night to the housekeeping staff, and round up the room service meal charge to the nearest $5) - but we've always found the staff to be helpful and attentive, and many of them even remember us by name. However, you can tell it's a luxury hotel because they charge you for everything in the room from Internet ($15/night!) to bottled water ($4 for a small bottle!), and there's no coffeemaker in any room or mini-fridge in most rooms. Food from room service is also expensive - if you can get away with paying less than $40/person for breakfast including coffee and juice (the one meal we usually eat in our rooms), count yourself lucky. The paid hotel Internet is really abysmal even by the category's generally poor standards - the last few visits, we've given up and used a mobile Internet hotspot from our cell phone provider. Most of the people you see in the lobby or Harry's Bar are either wealthy senior citizens or well-to-do foreign families clearly on holiday. I suspect that for those residents, the Helmsley Park Lane is a great hotel. But for business travelers, it's too expensive and not really set up for people who may need to sometimes work in their rooms, or come after a long day needing to eat after midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: keithandhelen3
Reviews.Content: A perfect location in a fabulous city. We got a great deal on book it for this hotel but were a little apprehensitive as some of the reviews were a little poor. However, that was not our experience as the staff were terrific as was the room and the views. We took the upgrade which more than paid for itself with the extras that were offered. The dining room, with its windows overlooking Central Park was a great place to start the day with a very large continental breakfast which was included in the upgrade. There is something nice about white linen and sterling silver. What better way to finish the day was to have a drink in Harrys Bar. A wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not great service”
Reviews.Author: Vickstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights as a first wedding anniversary trip. The location is good and the room was sizeable enough but attention to detail needs improving - there was a broken light in the bathroom and the phone wasn't working. The staff here were not helpful or pleasant. When we checked in the first thing we were told was that they had better rooms to upgrade to. I thought great, perhaps they will be nice given it is our wedding anniversary, but of course, they simply want to charge an extra $75 a night to do so which on top of what we had already paid was not worth it. I wonder if we had upgraded whether the service would have been more personable but I doubt it. They were not accommodating to us for a late check out and the concierge was patronizing in his response about transportation to the airport. I recognise in big cities like New York you don't get the same level of service, but is it really too much to ask for to feel like your custom is worth it, particularly in today's economy. Disappointing but didn't put a dampner on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “location is good, view is amazing, rooms are old”
Reviews.Author: Ebrudi
Reviews.Content: We have stayed on our last two visit to new york at helmsley park lane hotel.... The room was on 38th floor, one of the executive floors, with a great central park view.... The size of the room was good, but the bathroom was quite small and old. If you stay at an executive room, the continental breakfast is included, telephone calls and internet connections are free... What I like about this hotel is, location... If you want to stay uptown, close to central park and madison/fifth avenue with a good price, I think this hotel would be one of the best choises....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely room size”
Reviews.Author: gbosch
Reviews.Content: Despite paying 50% less for our room on an Expedia 12-hr deal, we expected our room to be very low and no view. We were put on the 11th floor (not too bad) but did not get a view of Central park. We did look out the back side onto the city buildings but we were not in our room enough to matter. The location is great and very easy for subway access and taxis. We felt the room was large (by NYC standards) and lovely towels, accompaniments, extremely comfy down beds, etc. Maids very friendly. All felt very safe. Doormen very helpful. Recommend eating right next door at the Plaza Hotel Food Court...nicest dining we have ever had in a 'food court'...you would be amazed. Communal-stlye dining but large diverse menu, excellent bar service, great atmosphere, and great food! The hotel had people from every country in the world and of all ages. I would stay here again if I could afford it. Our room was not outdated at all, and I disagree with the other negative reviews I have read.

Reviews.Title: “Only had a drink at the bar - thank god”
Reviews.Author: elveese
Reviews.Content: If Harry's is any indication, I can't imagine how awful a stay at this hotel would be. The place looks like God's Waiting Room - seriously, I think I was the only patron under 80 in the place. The staff is intolerably rude. In an uncrowded room, 4 bartenders stood around yakking for a good 5 minutes before one of them deigned to ask if I'd like a drink (what the hell did they think I was sitting at the bar for?). Nor did they place the peanut/olive snacks in front of me. I was the only single woman at the bar. Sometimes I hear hospitality staff complain about the way women tip. Maybe there's a cause/effect thing going on in some places. No tip for these guys, that's for sure. This is a very crappy establishment in a very lovely location.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbwest1
Reviews.Content: Okay, it's not the Four Seasons. Yes, the hotel decor is very "Mad Men" hip 60's. But, the Executive Floor suites facing Central Park have UNBELIEVABLE views of the park - absolutely stunning! Service is spot on. The majority of guests are European - mainly Italian. All in all, we had a huge suite on the 41st floor with amazing views of the park for a fraction of the cost at other 4 star properties. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: psditolvo
Reviews.Content: This is the best location in NYC for your money. The Central Park views are absolutely breathtaking. The interiors are kind of old and outdated, but who can look at the carpet with those views? I have stayed there maybe 5 or 6 times and it is my first choice when going to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: MandyMaldives2011
Reviews.Content: Fab old traditional hotel overlooking cantral park, I was a little bit apprehesive at first after reading some of the reviews. But what a pleasent suprise. Rooms were large and clean no wall paper hanging off a little dated but that added to it's charm.The beds were so comfortable I slept like a log every night. I wouln't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist Trap!”
Reviews.Author: Eastonlow
Reviews.Content: This hotel has something like 400 rooms, but facilities for maybe 40. As a result, there are long lines for everything. Check in, bag check, breakfast - all long lines. Call the concierge? Ten minutes on hold. Elevators? Wait five minutes each time, often watching cars pass, stuffed with people and no space to get in. The breakfast "buffet" consisted of a few muffins from some convenience store. There was juice and coffee, but no glasses. The staff - what few of them that exist - seemed exhausted and resigned to telling customers to wait and saying sorry. It is not just that it is grossly overpriced, it wouldn't be a nice place to stay at any price. Oh, and the executive floor room was dated and the bathroom tiny. Yes, the location is great, but give me a break!

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: brady33
Reviews.Content: We were visiting New York and stayed here three nights for my husband's 50th birthday. We were upgraded to the junior suite overlooking the park. The room was a great size, others we looked at were less than half the size of this one. The decor was very nice although you could see the need for the bathroom to be updated. The view was amazing and totally made our stay memorable. We ate in the restaurant overlooking central park and this too was lovely. Our family had came up to visit us and the restaurant staff were most accommodating in giving us great seats by the window. The whole hotel had a very nice charm about it and we will certainly return one day. The locatation was great and with the subway station nearby it is very accessible for all the attractions. If you are able to get a deal on the rooms when you book I would say that you could not go far wrong in choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location/ Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: newyboy50
Reviews.Content: The location as previously mentioned is excellent although the major subway stations are a few blocks walk. The slightly negative stuff: Bathroom was a little tired and needed a refit. Rooms were too hot for my liking because they have turned the a/c of for the cooler months. Some travellers like me prefer the room temperature to be sub 78 degrees to sleep. You could open the windows slightly to get some cooler air but then have to deal with the city noise, even from the 38th floor. Recommendation if you visit in winter and like to get under the covers at night, bring a set of ear plugs. The good stuff: Room decor was very nice, faux french. The view from the room was fantastic. Room 3816 which faces east has lovely morning golden light and looks over the east side, south east corner of Central Park and east over midtown. Lovely as dusk also. Bed was very comfortable. The staff are great. Very accommodating without pretence. Food and drinks are reasonably priced for a hotel of this calibre. The Green Cafe next door in 58th street is a very reasonable deli. Tip: If you want a contrast or to get away from the lovely gigs, around the corner in 6th Ave is a little deli called "Angela's Rock and Roll Deli". Very small shop front. They have outstanding food and cold beers. Their claim to fame is the "Rockin Steak Hero" sandwich. It is fantastic. The only thing better than the hero is the friendliness of Angela's staff. Look past the decor and have a local NYC experience.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel and the perfect base to explore NYC.”
Reviews.Author: KostakisG
Reviews.Content: If there is one word to describe this hotel, it would be "cosmopolitan" in the general sense of it. The exterior is american, the interior old european. I know there are much better hotels in NYC nowadays but in terms of style and location this can be a good choice for the world-wise traveller. Starting from the lobby, there is nothing spectacular but the atmosphere is cool, the lights soft, the furniture classic and the colour scheme elegant. The room upstairs where we enjoyed our fine breakfasts is great and I'd love to visit it again just to taste the same experience. Now the rooms: We had a city view twin room with queen beds and a picture window (a bit small) with a magnificent view of the city especially at nights. My only complaint was the bathroom which was basic compared to the rest of the room and covered in common white tles. Never mind, noone spends too much time in the bathroom while in NYC where there is a whole lot of better places to hang out. Staff OK, check-in took an unusual long time but everything else went smoothly and without major problems. I found the rate of the rooms very sensible as far as the services and the level of accomodation are concerned because NYC has become extremely pricey and you can easily find yourself trapped in a basic three-star hotel under the same price. I understand this may be an old hotel but it still wears well. I recommend the Helmsley Park Lane to everyone without thinking twice as a perfect base to explore the best of NYC. It may turn a bit touristy sometimes due to its unbeatable location and I feel that there is an urgent need for a furniture update or at least some sort of a facade lift. In the meantime, I'll keep this hotel in mind till the next time I visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect ANY help from the staff or management!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: We booked a 10 day stay through hotels.com quite a while ago specifying the need for either two double beds and a sleeper couch or a king sized bed and a sleeper couch for me, my sister and my niece. Then when we found out that our niece would arrive ahead of us after midnight, her fiance arranged for a room for one night. When she arrived in NYC, she phoned the hotel and they told her they didn't have a reservation from her and they were full. She then had to scramble and a find another hotel close by - Sheraton New York Towers and Suites. When we arrived at 6:30 AM, the staff didn't have any record of her being registered but sent us to a room registered to someone with her first name - we were horrified to discover this stranger at the door after we knocked. My sister and I had both turned off our cellphones on the plane and hadn't yet turned them back on. When we did we found out niece had moved. When we inquired about our reservation, we found they do not allocate rooms until you arrive and the only one available was with a single king sized bed - not enough for a big man and two women. We cancelled our reservation and moved to the Sheraton. Then we found out they charged my niece for one nights stay. It took three days for them to issue a credit - and we lost one night as a deposit for a room they would not let us use.

Reviews.Title: “Pack the Night Before Departure!”
Reviews.Author: newsanddeals
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here but now we're pretty certain turning off the air conditioning the night before departure was not a fluke. During the night we awoke sweating. After breakfast, we returned to the hot house to pack. Had to call in someone to open windows. Was told A/C was turned off since this was winter - in October! (Prior trip was in summer.) A little money-saving scheme, we suspect. We were supposed to have an renovated executive room on 44th floor. Huh?!! Bed was comfortable but fixtures askew, large mirror askew, bathroom minimal and dated, closet size of broom closet - disappointing. On plus side, right across from Central Park, staff attentive, dry cleaning amazing. Cabs did not know location. We hunted around for our new hotel next time. Sorry but we're moving on.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: glamontheroad
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be better in NYC hotel. The rooms are smallish but nice. Some of them are in need of updating. The executive floors are fully renovated. The room service is prompt and professional. There is nothing really negative to say about this property. You will get your money worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great service/perfect location/tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: BSWTRAVELS10
Reviews.Content: The location staff, vibe is great. Well worth the price for the rooms. We had a Central Park junior suite. The room was really lacking in decor. "Junior Suite" is also a word that was a bit stretched. I guess suite meant that there was a sofa and 2 chairs crammed in where 2 chairs would normally reside. The bathroom was very small with vinyl peeling wallcovering. The wall covering was peeling because of the steam that was trapped in the moldy seams. So if the price rises it is not worth the room, but for a payment in advance for three days was 378.00 per night (plus New York taxes) it is fine. You cant beat the location and view. The bed was very comfortable as was the quiet view. I have been to many New York hotels and would only stay here on a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: NACTucson
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days and came to think of the hotel as home. We had a beautiful park view and the rising sun was fabulous shining on the buildings. The room was spacious and accommodated 2 girlfriends nicely. They gladly furnished a small refrigerator for my medication. The only criticism I have is there was no easily accessible coffee - no coffee maker in the room or lobby so you would have had to order room service. Also they charge for Internet even printing boarding passes (though when I complained they did ours) I feel that at the rates they charge Internet shoud be included often I only needed it for restaurant research or such. Also it would help them if them if they had better signage to remind us there was a restaurant upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Park view in great location”
Reviews.Author: Allan_Glw
Reviews.Content: While needing just a little updating, the hotel was very good. Rooms were cleaned every day. When I asked, reception managed to get us a room higher in the hotel, for a better view of NY. Concierge was fine for arranging tickets for us. The cost of the drinks and snacks available in the room/fridge was very high though, which is probably the one minor negative point. Very central accross the road from Central Park, 20 yds from a subway, with bars and restaurants very near. Ideal position which suited us very well. In summary great location, helpful staff and agree with others that just a little tired, but didnt spoil our stay at all and would thoroughly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, but was that the Helmsley standard?”
Reviews.Author: twoguyswhotravel
Reviews.Content: Great location on Central Park South. This is a fine hotel with some 1950-60's style sophistication. Of special note are the very comfortable beds. The bath towels were also full and plush. The breakfast is well done and the view of the park is enjoyable. But, the property is tired. That 50s-60s decor, or whatever era it is, needs to be updated. The room furniture is dented up at the legs by what looks to be years of vacuum nicks, there is peeling wallpaper in some corners, the bathroom sink drawers were off their track, the shower tiles needed to be touched up (better yet, replaced completely), the closet door didn't even have a latch on it and it swung open, and the electronic room door key mechanism was coming loose from the door. For the price, we just thought it should have been more flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Park View with economy hotel customer service”
Reviews.Author: 93Kelly93
Reviews.Content: I am really conflicted. I want to like this hotel, but their front desk staff and customer service make it really hard. The views of the park are exquisite. I would only recommend this hotel if you can get a park view, if you canâ€™t save yourself the trouble and book at a hotel near the park like the Empire Hotel or the Waldorf Astoria. Their rooms here are large, especially by Manhattan standards, with full bathrooms. These are other pluses. I am unsure if the lack of customer service is simply a result of poor training and management or booking with priceline (though I have never had a problem booking with them before). Whatever the reason, this hotel seemed to have that dismissive tourist trap attitude towards customer service. I wonder how many repeat customers they throwaway this way. A front desk blunder turned into a debacle due to the significant lack of quality customer service. I realize front desks make mistakes, Iâ€™m not sure that I find it acceptable in the technology age to print off keys to an already booked room and deactivate the current room holderâ€™s keys. And there is certainly nothing tolerable about having your mother walked in on as she is changing for dinner. In a situation such as this, I cannot understand how oneâ€™s front desk transfers that call to security and hands off the complaint without making sure that the complaint is heard and a solution found. It seems that the least management could do in this situation is to comp the room for that night. But from the moment I checked in until the moment I checked out, I received different information every time I had a question. Upon check-in, I was told that the hotel was completely out of double rooms. I could upgrade to one for $75/ night on an executive floor. After their blunder, management offered to comp our room and to switch us to another queen room if we felt unsafe. Several conversations later, a double room was offered for the rate we had booked the queen room. I assumed that this meant the rate we had booked at minus the rollaway since we no longer needed it. When we returned to the hotel after dinner to make the change we were told that we would need to wait until noon the next day. Minutes later, we were called and asked if we were planning on switching our room because they had a bellman waiting to take us. As we were moving to our new room, the bellman informed us that we were moving to a room with a park view that we should be very happy to get and that New York was a large city and that we needed to realize that it was expensive and that it could be dangerous so expecting things to be perfectly safe was completely unrealistic. While I appreciate his candor, I wasnâ€™t aware that his lecture series on the nature of urban existence in the 21st century was part of the room charge. Upon check out, I realized that they continued to charge us the rollaway charge the entire stay. The $35/ night rollaway fee became a $35/ night upgrade fee for the park view. My assumption had been incorrect, but I wasnâ€™t the only person confused by what was meant by the room rate. Management seemed confused too, because the night they comped the room rate they still charged us the $35 fee. The management would have found a very devoted repeat customer if on Saturday night they had offered the solution of one night compensation and a move to a double room with a view of the park for rate of the room and the roll-away fee. I would have been overjoyed. Instead I was surprised and frankly annoyed by the bill when I got it. I had to ask about the conflicting information rather than the staff making sure there was no confusion. It was in congruence in service that makes it unlikely that I will stay there again and certain I will never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel fantastic touristy location.”
Reviews.Author: JDP527
Reviews.Content: Don't hesitate this hotel is clean, big rooms, and great location. I was on 15 th floor and was surprised how quiet and nice the room was. Excellent and courteous staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Classy well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Is0bella
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Helmsley Park Hotel it was beautifully decorated with a large Garden restaurant overlooking Central Park and a smaller bar panelled in wood serving beautiful cocktails. Our room was located on the 31st floor with a great view of Central Park, the room was lovely clean and very large with all amenities including a mini bar. Laundry service was excellent and very reasonably priced. Would stay here again a memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable, really nice part of the City”
Reviews.Author: draig_cymru
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel and really enjoyed our stay. We booked a 'Park View' room, though we were on the 7th floor therefore it was only a 'Tree View' room rather than a sweeping view over Central Park (Check with the hotel beforehand if that is something which would bother you!) which I'd imagine would require a room from the 12th-15th floor up? I was surprised how noisy it was late at night from the traffic going passed Central Park - but I suppose it's the busiest City in the world. Apart from that, the room was superb. Very spacious which I've not experienced in mid-priced hotel rooms in NYC on previous trips. Bed was really comfortable. The bathroom was great with a walk in shower that was really good. We didn't use any of the hotel facilities (i.e bar/restaurant/fitness room) because New York City was on the doorstep! The great thing about the hotel is that it is in walking distance from some really good sites and the subway. We felt really safe and there were plenty of really good places to drink and eat nearby. Would definetely stay again - especially considering that they had some good deals for this hotel on the internet. That made this hotel only marginally more expensive than some really poor hotels with shared bathrooms. I spent hours trawling the Net and Trip Advisor looking for a quality hotel in NYC to suit my budget - In my opinion you would be hard pressed to find a better hotel / location for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Classic luxury in a good location for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: samanthaonstyle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Helmsley Park Lane for a business trip, and it was perfectly lovely, though I probably wouldn't book this hotel for a regular visit to NYC. ROOM: The best aspect is that the rooms are very large for NYC standards, and clean and modern with old-world charm. For business, there is ample closet space, a desk, and a decent, well-lit bathroom. ROOM SERVICE: Like most hotels in NYC, the extras can add up, but it's a good value for the price. I needed room service before an early meeting, and it was definitely more expensive than going to a bagel shop, but convenient. CHECK-IN/OUT: The check-in area is a little cramped and chaotic. My room wasn't ready when I arrived at 1pm, but they were able to hold my luggage. I arrived back to the hotel after a day of meetings and my room key didn't work either, and then it took two tries before I got the correct room key. However, these are minor inconveniences and wouldn't deter me from staying again. LOCATION: If you're traveling as a couple on a tourism trip to NYC, you'll also like the location on Central Park and close to shopping, theater, and tourist attractions. If you have business in Midtown, you can walk most anywhere. However, for a fun weekend in NYC, it's probably not the best location. You won't find any hip restaurants or party spots nearby, and it can be difficult to get a taxi in this crowded area.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: corey10
Reviews.Content: amazing hotel. only fault was the room wasnt ready on time and the blind was broke it was all fixed within an hour with a free cocktail flung in.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: BlackBadger79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Helmsley Park Lane Hotel for two nights in August, and took the option to upgrade to one of their Executive Rooms on the 39th floor with park view. This is by no means a cheap hotel, pitching themselves much more at the higher end of the market. That said, the higher end of the market is very much where they belong. The room was spacious, bright, modern and immaculately clean. The view of Central Park was simply outstanding and a real highlight of our trip. In terms of service, this was professional and courteous throughout our stay, particularly at breakfast. The buffet breakfast boasted a good range of bagels, cakes, fruit and yoghurt - and our coffee was replenished with impressive frequency. Harry's Bar is worth a look if you've got the Executive package as it entitles you to a 'free' drink each night of your stay. The bar was well stocked and had a nice, softly-lit decor, whilst the coctails were delicious. If you've not got the 'free' drink you might want to pass, however, as the prices weren't so much steep as vertical. As with any accomodation there's a trade-off to be had in terms of price and quality. Doubtless there are cheaper hotels in Manhattan, but if you've got the cash to spare the Helmsley Park Lane Hotel will deliver in terms of service and quality. Its location, more importantly, is amongst the best you will find for Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Fading 4-star, but worth a look”
Reviews.Author: kathyj123
Reviews.Content: The Helmsley Park Lane has an excellent location on Central Park South the the park views are just stunning. If you're patient and resourceful, you can generally get a park view room at a discounted rate through one of the travel sites. Get one. You'll be glad you did. Now for the not so nice parts. Our bathroom grout was pretty disgusting. Our room was otherwise very clean. Unfortunately, I didn't discover this fact until after we had unpacked and settled in, so it would have been too much of a pain to switch rooms. Because of that, we didn't complain, so I don't fault the management for failing to rectify the issue. I DO, however, fault them for creating the situation in the first place. If housekeeping didn't know about it, they should have. If the house manager didn't know, he/she should have. This wasn't something that happened over a few days. This had to have happened over a long period of time. So if the people responsible don't care about the cleanliness of the room, why would they care if I had complained? Also, the front of house staff was less than friendly, with the exception of the bellmen. The bellmen were very friendly and helpful. The front desk staff was efficient but terse, and on check out actually asked my husband, "What do you want?" The concierge was no better. He was an older gentleman who I never saw crack a smile. I went to him to print out our boarding passes for our flight home. While waiting in line behind another customer, an employee patrolling the lobby asked if he could help me. I told him what I needed and he said I could either wait for the concierge or go up to the business center where there would be a charge. I thanked him and stayed in line. When it was my turn, the concierge told me that I needed to go up to the business center. I told him what the other man had said and his reply was, "Well, you'd have to have all your flight information with you for me to do that." I said it was on my phone and pulled it up. He proceeded to take two phone calls and did some filing while I waited with my information. He eventually entered my info and printed the boarding passes. Still no smile. I've stayed here 3 or 4 times and for me it's all about the central location and the view. However, if this is your "big once in a lifetime trip to New York" I would look elsewhere. If you really need the help of the concierge, expect good service and want a well-maintained room then this hotel isn't for you. If you're a frequent traveler to NYC and can make a few compromises in exchange for a great location and an even better view at a decent price, then give this hotel a look.

Reviews.Title: “Classic New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrawdenBadger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Helmsley Park Lane for five nights and it lived up to all our expectations. Our room was on the top floor with views over the park and city. We received an upgrade which included free continental breakfast and free drink in the bar each night. The room was just perfect, with a fabulous, comfortable super Kingsize bed. The standard of the furnishings and decor was first class, with wonderful little touches, such as an umbrella, chocolates, a large flat screen tv and toiletries which were replaced each day. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. The concierge was most helpful in recommending a fabulous little Thai restaurant nearby and also booked tickets for Phantom. The breakfasts were served in the main dining room overlooking central park. Wonderful fresh fruit, bagels and Danish pastries were included with the continental breakfast but we could have chosen more or less anything we asked for. Silver service and pleasant and attentive service. The location of the Helmsley is perfect, right across the road from Central Park, which was perfect for my early morning runs! The black out blinds and double glazing kept the New York noise at bay! We can't recommend this hotel highly enough and we plan to return. First class!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointig”
Reviews.Author: Francesca D
Reviews.Content: yes, location is terrific but...decor is very dated and customer service not one of the best we experienced! The impression we had is that this hotel used to be grand but now is just shabby. The only reason to stay there is the breathtaking view of Central Park, so be sure to book a park view room on the highest possible floor !

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Caya50
Reviews.Content: My husband, our two twenty something daughters and I stayed here for one week at the beginning of June, 2011.
