We had 2 rooms on separate floors, (our choice) - the rooms were very large, clean and well kept. The decor is dated, but the size of the rooms more than made up for this. Location is terrific, as the front of the hotel overlooks Central Park, and is around the corner from The Plaza, Bergdorf Goodmans, and Fifth Avenue. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant, every morning we went through the back entrance to The Green Cafe right next door, where they make fresh omelettes, toast, eggs etc. cafeteria style. Great value and very fresh. Check hotels.com and also call the hotel directly to get the best rates - compare, as they can vary.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and I already went back there”
Reviews.Author: ppassaro
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a very good cost/ benefit ratio and is extremely well located, walking distance from many vary interesting sites, close to the subway as well you can go anywhere on the Island. They could just work on some maintenance and improving service that can always get better.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: MrsLSouthWales
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 3 nights last week. Sadly our room had a view of the back of lots of buildings, but the room was bog. Air conditioning was really noisy as was the plumbing, but room was comfortable and clean. Good location for Central Park, subway, walking to Empire State Building, 5th Avenue shops, museum mile, Times Square and plenty of good places to eat (including breakfast) on 6th Avenue. Just remember not to take anything off the min-bar shelf - the prices are crazy!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel would love to stay again”
Reviews.Author: milliecox
Reviews.Content: THis is a beautiful hotel with friendly, helpful polite staff. We had two room both excellent, spacious comfortable with astounding views over central park . We had a very happy time here. You are within walking distance of many important sites (e.g. Central Park, the Frick collection, the Metropolitan (bit of a walk), Rockefellar centre. We did not eat here all the time (because we wanted to eat out in New York to get as many different experiences as possible) but we did eat in tne garden cafe once which was excellent. There are many cafes and restaurants in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Will NOT be back.”
Reviews.Author: Jess A
Reviews.Content: Read a view dodgy reviews about this hotel which I was a little skeptical about but thought I would be optimistic as everyone does have a complete different experience. I have had dreams of coming to New York all my life (from Australia) so I was pretty excited. When we arrived in our cab, a doorman named 'Nana' (tall black male) got our bags out of the cab in which I tipped him for and he SNATCHED the cash out of my hand. I was a little drawn back from that experience and shrugged it off. We went to check in and were greeted with an unenthusiastic girl (forget her name) who tried upgrading us for $75 a night (We were staying well over a week so obviously this was way too costly). We declined. She was not very helpful or nice and from then, I felt a little dissapointed. She then called 'Nana' the same doorman that one minute prior had carried out luggage from the cab and instructed him to take us to our room. Upon arriving, we walked in and he put our bags in. He stood there for a few seconds when I looked at him he said "AREN'T YOU GOING TO PAY ME?" in a very aggressive tone. I understand that they work on tips and this is common but considering I had already tipped him I said "no, I have already given you money.' He then proceeded to tell me "NO!!!!!, that was for me getting your bags out of the cab, you now need to pay extra because I took them into your room." I wanted to argue with him about because I knew he was trying to take advantage of me because I was foreign but he was towering over me so I just gave him a dollar to get out of my room. I was disgusted that a hotel that boasts about their standard would employ somebody so rude who would try and intimidate their guests!! DEFINITELY NOT LIKE THE MOVIES. The room was TINY but probably huge due to New York standards as they are known for their shoebox sized rooms. It was clean (found a lot of hair in the bathroom) and the bed was very comfortable. The noise was a little bit of a problem and there was no privacy if you had your window open. We had a "city view" however, should be renamed "wall view" as we were facing apartments and had people staring at us if we ever opened the blinds. Location was amazing, right across the road from Central Park, nearly next door to the famous Plaza Hotel and a walk away from 5th avenue. Wifi was expensive but you could walk down 1 minute down the street and pick up free apple store wifi. If you are a first time New York visitor, I would probably recommend staying a little closer to Times Square because that is where the action is and where all the tours leave etc I would maybe consider coming back if they SACK that door man NANA. He still makes me angry!!!! and teach their staff to smile and be nice. I rated it as a poor experience as the service outweighed everything else .. it just made a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room unlike typical nyc hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: rosetea26
Reviews.Content: I visit new york very often with my husband. It was our first time staying at the Helmsley Park Lane hotel and to my excitement I was glad that we did. The rooms are spacious.. Well the one we stayed in overlooking central park. We had breakfast included and even thought it was the continental breakfast filled with mouth watering pastries, we had the option of ordering a la carte. The service was great Dany and Solis were always ensuring my husband and I were pleased. When I wanted to inquire information about restaurants and broadway shows Brenda was sweet, patient, and attentive. I highly recommend the Park Lane..

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lousy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: emrodri
Reviews.Content: Very well located at Central Park South, beautiful view. Good staff. Nice room, the bathroom is old, could be refurbished. The continental breakfast is lousy. The restaurant is small, there is a waiting line to be seated every morning. The buffett is very limited and by end of morning not all items are replenished.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: Christine K
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 1:30pm on a Monday afternoon. The Receptionist was very welcoming. She told us we had a room with the view of Central Park. I was amazed because I hadn't requested it. Our room was spacious, very clean and what a view. We had a problem with the boudoir chair near may bed. I went down to report it. As I was entering my room the head of housekeeping was right behing me. She saw what was wrong and within 10 minutes we had a new chair. Our housekeeper was delightful. She cleaned our room to perfection. We asked for directions to the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the concierge was very helpful. We had intended to do more sightseeing but our family kept us busy with their own version of sightseeing which was wonderful. I decided I wanted a late check out and called the reception desk at 8:00am. That was not a problem I was given the late check out without any discussion. The food at the Park restaurant was very good. We only ate breakfast there. I must say it was pricey but then everywhere we ate was pricey. If you plan on going to NYC make sure your credit card has no balance or minimum amount on it because you will be using it a lot. On a scale of 1-10 I give this hotel an 11. It was comfortable, quiet even though it was very busy with the foreign visitors, pleasant lobby although no gift shop. They took the gift shop out and put in an expensive jewelry store, very tiny only two people can fit in it at once. This hotel made our stay very very pleasant, and once again the view of Central Park was phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Chic and Wonderful View”
Reviews.Author: nurin
Reviews.Content: if ,cracking drawers, peeling wallpaper and a bit noisy ac , dont "frighten" you , then this Shabby Chic hotel is just for you,,,,,,,,the View - allover central park - is s u p e r b ,,,,,,,service is kind (always cheering housemaids, Leon and Danny in the beautiful, park- overlooking breakfast room shows their respect for the tradition of waiting on guests old-style, mail room's Ben is wonderful, and everywhere there are beautiful fresh flower arrangements } we'll return,,,,,,actually we already have a pre-paid reservation for next month.......

Reviews.Title: “One day in NY”
Reviews.Author: delicatny_macho
Reviews.Content: It was on the way back home after our Central America holidays. We had 24 hours for New York. So we needed the hotel that has good location.The Helmsley Park Lane is really that one. The hotel is located just in front of Central Park. Just in a couple of steps from Underground station, in 1 minute from Apple store and fashionable 5th Avenue. Just in 2 stops from Rockefeller center and 3 stops from Times Square or Guggenheim museum. In the hotel itself you can feel like you're in 1920's. The hall, the stairs, the elevators, the restaurant - all of that saved unrepeatable atmosphere of those days. Friendly and professional staff provides very comfortable stay. We had a small trouble with our booking, but hotel receptionist was very effective and she disposed of it in a minute without any questions. So, why wouldn't you stay at the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “nice location, dirty bathroom, be aware of doormen”
Reviews.Author: DaD-trip1
Reviews.Content: Location was nice. We could not get a room at a sufficiently high floor to actually see Central Park as we demanded, even though we paid extra for a room with the Park view. That's ok as we spent most of our time outside. We did not experience much noise (our room did face Central Park side) even at a low floor and we had a good sleep. Toilet bowl was dirty and could not be cleaned despite the efforts of the cleaning lady who was very nice. Otherwise, the room was decent. A doormen of the hotel tried to cheat us when we asked for a taxi to Newark airport. He practically tried to force us physically into a limo of his "buddy" (doorman's words) for a price of 90 dollars. When we refused and asked for a regular taxi the doorman told the taxi driver that he should also charge us 90 dollars or more. The taxi driver then tried to make us pay a flat fee of 100 dollars but we told him that we shall complain and basically scared him with few more comments. We finally payed a little bit more than 60 dollars. While it was not pleasant to finish our vacation in New York which such an experience we finally laughed at this. You certainly would not expect stuff in a hotel charging regular rooms 390 dollars/night and more to behave like that. But I guess it's not surprising, there are crooks everywhere and we should not be surprised to experience this at a Helmsley place. Tradition, I guess. Internet was 9.90 dollars per 24 h. This was the third time on this trip on which we changed some 14 hotels that we had to pay for internet. The more expensive hotel, the more you have to pay for basic things such as internet, newspapers,...The funny thing is that hotel management explains to you that you are being charged "for your convenience".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: rickandleigh
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night trip with my daughter, 11 and my mother, 66. Neither one of them had ever been to NYC. My daughter was turning 11 while we were there. After check-in, Bobby showed us to our rooms. I got 2 rooms overlooking Central Park for a wonderful price. When Bobby found out that we were there to celebrate a birthday he immediately got on the phone to see if we could get a higher room for the view. He exemplified what customer service should be. Later that day I had a problem with my debit card and Haythem, the manager, was very patient while I worked things out with my bank. The hotel is in the perfect location with subways, shopping and Central Park right at your finger tips. The beds are unbelievably comfortable, also! The ONLY negative thing I might have is that the rooms need a little updating but the service and location outweighed the dated decor. Thank you for making such a memorable experience for my daughter's 11th birthday!

Reviews.Title: “LOcation....location and very comfortable, too”
Reviews.Author: argoii
Reviews.Content: My wife and me. How breathtaking the view of Central Park from the 42th floor. The breakfast..... nothing special but a joy to watch the waiters serving the customers. Can not be described. They were either very capable ones or from other planet. The concierge desk generally was very capable. If you can afford it, ask high floor, park view. Shop around, by phone or in their website, for promotions. Sometimes, they change every week. Sorry for my English. By the way, poor English does not matter too much in New York. New Yorkers don' t speak so well the English language, either. I will come back, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but tired”
Reviews.Author: Montydoro
Reviews.Content: My first trip to New York and my expectations were set low about the sort of luxury that my company's travel budget would provide. Still, I found the Helmsley's lower rooms particularly gloomy, dirty and dated. The combination of the traffic noise (yes I know it is New York), nearby building work and elderly aircon didn't help and I upgraded to a room higher up in the building after my first night. Whilst this was a notable improvement in noise and cleanliness, this hotel still didn't do it for me and I won't rush back. The mitigating factors were that the rooms were reasonably spacious, there was a grand, if expensive, dining room, and proximity to the park - which helped me run off some of the jetlag when I woke at 4am!

Reviews.Title: “Got our money's worth just from the view”
Reviews.Author: Fahdamjad
Reviews.Content: We took a chance with this hotel knowing that some reviews at trip advisor were less than convincing. Paying 300 dollars a night was a bit steep for us but in hindsight it was worth it. We did not use much facilities but the concierge was quite helpful in planning our trip. The room is spacy and on our request we were given a higher floor on the 24th floor. It was a park view room with a large lounge space overlooking central park. The location is nice as it is comfortably distant from times square - this is what we wanted. Every hotel on this road is not less than 30-40% more expensive for a similar room. The rooms were clean. The only thing that stood out was that the minibar was empty. Wifi is 9.99$ per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: eztraveler65
Reviews.Content: This venerable hotel has been spruced up since I stayed there last. It sits right in front of Central Park with beautiful views. It is not as pricy as other similar hotels. We enjoyed Harry's bar after the theater. It was quiet and a great way to end the evening. I would have liked more channel selections on the large flat screen TV in the room ( Golf Channel and YES for instance) but who goes to NYC to watch TV? There are newer and fancier hotels but the Park Lane is comfortable. Breakfast in the dining room overlooking the park is a treat. We got carryout breakfast at nearby deli one morning and saved big bucks. I shall return.

Reviews.Title: “old hotel, great price, ugly rooms, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: diseï¿½ï¿½adora
Reviews.Content: It was a last minute trip, I needed a good hotel, with a very small price. Through a friend, we got a very good price. When we arrived we were thrilled at the location, the excitement wore off when we say the room. Although it had the best view of the park, the rooms was ugly, old, very very old, the beds were terrible. We never asked for a wake up call, the first night, they called us at 6.00 o'clock mistakenly. The second night, seems to be that the cleaning lady set up the alarm clock at our rooom at 6.30 ( we still wonder why), the third night, we received the unwanted wake up call, again ! We loved the location, hated the rooms...Service was good though. Too bad for the appearance .

Reviews.Title: “Filthy dirty bathroom”
Reviews.Author: marincogirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 2206. The too wasn't terrible. It seemed clean enough even though half of the lamps/lighting didn't work. The 9.95 per day wifi didn't operate well, and I was triple charged for mini bar items. The worst was the bathroom, which was so filthy I was compelledto take photosto show my corporate travel agent why I will never stay in this hotel again. Tub, toilet, basin, wall and fixtures were dirty. Not just "oh you missed a spot" dirty, but like homeless person looking dirty. I realized after staying here that it primarily cates to foreign tourists, but shame on you for showing tourists such a dirty representation of NY at the prices you charge.

Reviews.Title: “Will Go Back for Sure”
Reviews.Author: scinstallation
Reviews.Content: I called the W for a room they where booked. The Customer Service Rep advised me of the new property so I said Yes I wish I took her name down but she was awesome as well.. Upon arrival till departure everything was great. The hotel does need updating and I am sure Starwood will do a great job. I want to say that Leah the F&B Manager could not have been nicer. What a great employee you have and an asset to your Company. My stay was a 5 star stay

Reviews.Title: “Good but costly for breakfast and no free internet”
Reviews.Author: EnglandLondon
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms and comfortable bed. Free safe in the room. Internet access is charged at $9.99 for 24 hours and isn't free anywhere in the hotel. Was offered a turn down service in my room once in 4 nights but that service doesn't matter to me so much. DÃ©cor in the rooms isn't to my taste but is perfectly reasonable and not a reason not to stay. Location is directly across the road from Central Park. The hotel is within walking distance of Times Square. The concierge at this hotel was extremely helpful and provided maps and information on tours etcâ€¦ We booked the TV and Movie tour and the hop on and hop off bus tour which stops directly opposite the hotel. We stayed for 4 nights and had a great time in New York - can't wait to go back and would stay in this hotel again if the price was right. If you book directly with the hotel join their reward scheme as I believe you will then get an upgraded room and free internet access. Breakfast in the hotel wasn't the best and was very expensive, instead just go to some of the places on 9th Avenue between 46th and 56th Streets as it's a lot cheaper than the hotel and more choice. Also it's cheaper than the restaurants in Times Square and is only a few minutes walk away. Only issue with this hotel was that a shower cap I brought with me was mistakenly thrown away by the housekeeping staff and they didn't leave any of the ones provided by the hotel (it's a shower cap so I'm not going to go mad about it), I called housekeeping and just asked if I could have one of the standard hotel ones and they were a bit shirty on the phone but they sent someone up with a handful (literally - I've no idea why as I was only asking for one and not complaining my own one had been thrown out or removed from my room) of shower caps shortly afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location......BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: 30thanniversary
Reviews.Content: We would never stay here again. This place needs some TLC. how does it get four stars?

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TanyaP022
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to NYC. I was able to take my family to the Helmsley Park Lane which is my favorite hotel in New York. We were not disappointed. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. I appreciate the elegance and character of this "established" property. The location is PERFECT to reach all areas of Manhattan easily by taxi, foot or subway and it is incredibly safe. I will return to this jewel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Hbremen
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel. The girl at the front desk got us a high room so we had an unbelievable view of the park! Everyone was friendly and helpful and the location of this hotel was awesome. It was the highlight of our trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodations in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: aeliza723
Reviews.Content: The Helmsley Park Lane is a beautiful hotel with a very helpful, professional staff. The room was comfortable with ample space for two adults and two children. The bed was the most comfortable bed that I have slept in away from home. We ate breakfast in the dining room and were impressed with both the quality of the food and the efficiency and pleasant manner of all servers. The location is ideal since it is right across from Central Park. I would definitely want to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect introduction to The Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: jpwBrighton
Reviews.Content: My sister & I travelled to NYC as a treat for her 40th birthday & we wanted a fairly central hotel where we would feel safe. The Helmsley did not disappoint, it was perfect. Friendly, helpful staff, beautiful decor, huge comfy beds & perfect location. It was everything we could have wished for & more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TomTom1986
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed for a week over the 4th of July holiday period and loved the hotel. The staff where always helpful and the rooms where nice and cool, temperatures were up in the 90's so it was nice to come back to the air con. 1 down side was the beds where too comfortable, New York isn't the kind of place you want to waste your days in bed but you really could on those mattresses! This was the 3rd time I had visited NYC and on a previous trip I stayed in the Grand Hyatt, comparing the 2 I really couldnâ€™t justify spending the extra to stay anywhere other than here. The location is perfect and the views are great, even if you have a city view like we did. Iâ€™m trying to find a negative to list and I suppose the only thing I could would be a little bit of wall paper peeling off under the bathroom sink! and thatâ€™s nothing really! oh, and there's no tea and coffee making facilities which would of been handy! We booked a room through cityandshow.com and got a weekâ€™s stay for Â£800, that money in NYC......I donâ€™t think you'll get better than the Helmsley!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and elegant. Best hotel we've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: alnesser
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Helmsley Park Lane with my wife (then fiancee) in August 2009. This was her first trip to my hometown, so I wanted to make this visit as special as I could. I had been wanting to stay at this hotel for years, and was glad to finally have been able to create the opportunity. This is an elegant hotel in a great area of Manhattan. We got excellent service from the start. Check-in was hassle-free, and the man who assisted with unloading our bags from the car and taking them up to our room was very friendly and professional. On our room's desk we found a personalized welcome note and some cookies that were left for us, which was a nice, personal touch. To make our stay extra-special, I made sure to get a park view room. There is just no better way to enjoy a stay at this hotel! I'll never forget the look of awe on my wife's face as she walked towards the window as soon as we walked into the room, taking in her first impression of the fantastic Central Park view from the 34th floor. Going to sleep with the curtains wide open and waking up in the middle of the night to such a clear view of the low, full moon through the room's huge windows was nothing short of surprising and unforgettable! It seemed as if the moon was right outside the window! Our room was extremely comfortable, with an excellent king-size bed and a fairly big flat-screen tv,that was a pleasure unwinding down in front of at night after a long day of pounding the pavement. The mini-bar/snacks went untouched, for it was just too pricy. The room was very clean, though it's apparent that it could use some updating (especially the bathroom). We absolutely love the hotel's location, directly across the street from Central Park and just down the street from Columbus Circle. We drove up from Florida, and as a free alternative to paying through the nose for parking, we left the car in a free space for a few days in a nicer part of my native Washington Heights, given that we didn't need a car every day. Taking a train back downtown and then uptown again a few days later to retrieve the car was no big deal (way better than paying $32/day for parking around the Helmsley). My wife and I cannot wait to stay at the Helmsley Park Lane again next summer!!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: intreped
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a less expensive (not recently renovated) park view room. For an extra $150 you can get a renovated room with breakfast and internet included, but we don't see the need. As in the past when we have stayed at this hotel, the room was spacious and clean, the king sized bed was comfortable and well appointed, and the view of Central Park was spectacular. Considering the location and price, this is one of the best hotel deals in NYC. We like the fact that this hotel is not quite as upscale as nearby hotels like the Ritz and Trump, which tend to be overrun by super-rich foreigners (although we have splurged on those places a coupleof times). On the weekend, anyway, there are plenty of families enjoying breakfast at the beautiful restaurant which overlooks the park. The staff are always friendly and helpful without being overbearing or stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, pretty view, good location and consistently poor service”
Reviews.Author: BulldogMatt
Reviews.Content: Other than Anthony at the Concierge desk, who was helpful, these employees need to go back to customer service 101. Upon arriving at the hotel, the Front Desk agent offered an upsell to me for $75/night. The problem was that it was very clear that the room I had booked was not available. For about 10 minutes, the agent paced and kept checking the computer. A gentleman assisted him who never said hello and told him the rate to quote to me but never addressed me personally. Manager, perhaps? The room was nice with the amazing view of Central Park lovely. I was told that the room was a Junior Suite? In my view, the addition of two extra chairs does not make a Junior Suite. At one point, I went to the Mail & Information desk to ask about breakfast times the next morning. Kristy's response was to "check with the Concierge." Really, at the information desk? We did have a nice breakfast at the Park Room one morning. The staff here was phenominally better than the Front Desk staff. On my check in day, I called Front Desk 4 times to have someone assist me with the air conditioner. No one came. I think it is important to state we paid a high rate to stay here. I expect much better customer service for this price. Also, the dance/club music in the lobby does not fit with the Helmsley Park Lane feel/image. I would not choose to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Fantastic......”
Reviews.Author: joanne671
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Helmsley for my 40th birthday, we stayed for 7 nights. We upgraded to a Deluxe Park Room View and it was fabulous, it was clean and the views where amazing, our only complaint would be lack of tea and coffee facilities in room. The staff was always helpful when ever we asked anything, and on our 1st night we had chocolate cake delivered with a little card for my birthday which I thought was really nice. We would definately stay here again, the location was great too. Just 1 more little thing, check your bill as they do seem to put mini bar charges on even if you haven't used it. All in all though this is a really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasent surprise”
Reviews.Author: Googan2012
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews on this hotel, we almost cancelled our reservation for a one-week stay. I am glad we didn't! Being a frequent traveller that stays at the finest hotels around the world, I found this hotel to be an excellent place to stay in Manhatten. The staff were highly courteous, the suite we stayed in on the 44th floor was specious with spectacular views, and the housekeeping was also upto par, with high standards of cleanliness being met at all times in our suite. All the horror stories I had read on Trip Advisor regarding bed bugs etc were certainly not experienced during our stay. If it was a problem in the past, then the management has certainly done a good job with cleaning up the place. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Manse100
Reviews.Content: We had a week in this hotel and couldn't fault it at all. Great central park location, rooms were very clean, food was lovely. Just round the corner from fifth avenue, and close to the tube. Would be happy to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: PaJeff84
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Helmsley Park Lane for a weekend vacation and to attend concert @ Carnegie Hall. The location on Central Park and near the concert hall is great. Everyone at the hotel was courteous, pleasant, and went out of their way to help us, and they all took time to talk to my 8 year old daughter. We were able to check in 5 hours early and the hotel held our luggage for half a day while we walked around the city before leaving. When we had a problem with my daughter's dress, they found some needle & thread to fix it, and wouldn't accept any tip for the help. Parking is conveniently located at the hotel, but is expensive like most NYC parking. The view of the city from the 32nd floor was nice. The lobby is very elegant. Our room was older, but very clean. This was one of a few hotels that had two double beds in a regular room so our daughter could stay in the same room as us (without having to get a suite). The cost was not cheap, but is was reasonable for a NYC hotel on Central Park. Next time we need to stay in Midtown, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: busytraveller25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutey wonderful. We have recenlty had our honeymoon in New York and the Helmsley Park Lane was the perfect hotel. The location can not be beaten, easy access to the east and west sides of central park, just a stroll away from times square, simply put perfectly located. The room was cleam and very comfortable, the views were fantastic. I can honestly say the the hotel staff were friendly and very helpful, we did not eat at the hotel so no coments there, but simply on service and location it gets my approval.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but just a bed factory”
Reviews.Author: GrandTone
Reviews.Content: Good points; Great Location on Central Park South; Comfortable beds; Excellent Concierge, Anthony; and an adequate buffet breakfast. Otherwise totally soul less - booked on recommendation for our honeymoon, promised special attention in writing by hotel management for our five night stay including upgraded accommodation - on arrival given a room with no view - had to fight for a better room - no promised "special attention" - problems sorting out overcharges on bill at check out only to discover on arrival home that additional charges have been made to my credit card. Would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel , Lovely Staff , Unparalleled Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: dmtravel7890
Reviews.Content: Our trip began with an upgrade to a lovely executive double room with a city view. The room was very tastefully decorated in muted gold tones . We were so happy with the size ! Our view was great , the windows were just how we like them , LARGE ! The beds were extremely comfortable , so nice for a peaceful rest after a long day in New York . We enjoyed lunch in the beautiful main dining room which overlooks Central Park . Pampered is the key word here - a veteran staff of nicely uniformed waiters attended our every need . The lobster bisque to start was perfect , as was the rest of our meal . It was a nice nod to Helmsley corporate and upper management to learn that most of the employees here have been with this hotel for 20 plus years . Step across the street and straight into Central Park ! Walk to the corner and cross the street to FAO Schwartz , toy wonderland for "kids" of all ages . This is our new favorite hotel in New York City , We like to feel spoiled and Ms. Marie and her staff managed to oblige on a large scale . Thank You....We will return , Ashley Finney and family

Reviews.Title: “My HOT night in New York”
Reviews.Author: morningbeader
Reviews.Content: My husband and decided to spend a mini weekend in Mahnattan ( we live in Long Island NY) to celebrate my 60th birthday. We had dinner reservations for Saturday night and tickets to a matinee performance and brunch on Sunday. We chose the Park Lane because it was the ideal location and a special occasion. When we arrived at 3PM the room felt very hot, but we were anxious to go out and enjoy the afternoon. We came back at 5ish and lowered the thermostat but it kept jumping back up to a higher temp. We called maintenance and they said they would send someone up. Instead of being able to relax before we went out for the night, we waited and waited but no one ever came. We figured that it would be taken care of while we were out. We came back around 11PM and the room still was boiling hot. My husband spoke to someone in engineering who suggested that we open the windows( guess you have to be an engineer to think of that) or change rooms(at 11PM!) He mentioned to my husband that the room we were in (3516) was hot because the heat ran through the closet wall in the 16 line(. If the thermostat work ed that would not have been a problem.) I filled out a room comment card and handed it in to the front desk. Our express check out had been processed so they did not offer to adjust the bill in any way to make up for our uncomfortble night in the room.The woman at the front desk gave me her card along with an appology and said that the next time we came back she would give us a room upgrade! About a week later I received a letter of appology from the resident manager assuring me that the "problem" had been addressed and that it was going to be handled in an "expeditious manner" He told me how much he valued me as a customer, and he too invited me back to" restore my confidence"...unfortunately, he is expecting me to foot the bill for him to do that! If you look at their website, you will notice that the word "service" is mentioned several times, however, as you can see from this review we never got to experience it! A good restaurant will bend over backwards to fix something to assure that you come back again, which often includes a bill adjustment, a dessert, something. Apparantly the Park Lane Hotel thinks that a letter of appology is enough...it is not!

Reviews.Title: “An extremely bad kept "3 stars" Hotel, but well positioned”
Reviews.Author: FabioDaGenova
Reviews.Content: Positive: great position (just in front to Central Park, few meters from the tube station) , nice view (if you have the park-view rooms only), large size rooms, decent service. Negative: a very bad kept Hotel, extremely tired, with hugly,old and dirty fornitures, extremely expensive. Just as a note: in case you want to have the breakfast, prepare yourself to wait in a very long line. At the price you pay, there are surely much better Hotels in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Fantastic Octopus Price”
Reviews.Author: StepTrac Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Upgraded room (would have been a bargain even without the upgrade). Very Good but not excellent standard of furnishings (but well more than could have been expected for the price), basic bathroom but perfectly fine. Reception and breakfast room staff helpful and knowledgeable. Only slight niggle was lack of security - anyone could walk in and acess the guest corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value at Central Park.”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsPeter
Reviews.Content: This hotel just became part of the Preferred Hotels chain. Excellent value for your buck : great location on Central Park South with astonishing views on Central Park. Old hotel which could need some renovation work, but that would then raise the room rates, which are lower than comparables. Rather rude service in restaurant and bar, which can be explained by the fact that the waiters seem to own the place, as they must have been there for years.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best locations in NY”
Reviews.Author: Magajo
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in last trip to NY and was impressed with its excellent location. The hotel is old and offers what I would call an Old Time Luxury style that may or may not suit your expectations...I actually prefer modern buildings... The check-in was quick and they gave me an upgrade which meant a little larger room (although no park view), free wifi at the room and free continental breakfast; unfortunately, there is no executive floor or lounge. The room was large with an HD LCD tv and a king size; the bathroom was disappointedly small and showed its age; some of the room features also showed their age, and the carpet could have been cleaner. The minibar is motion-sense activated so anything you remove for longer than 20 seconds gets automatically billed. Bed was very comfortable and linens were crisp and clean. Breakfast is at a large room and service is of course old-fashioned with plenty of waiters that seems a bit uninterested at that time of the day; my free continental breakfast was small (coffee, fruit , yogurt and a muffin) although I don't need really more than that; unfortunately there is no free wifi at the restaurant. All the personnel from bell boys, concierge, doorman, etc., were very pleasant and eager to help in the typical NY style. The check-out was fast with the bill delivered during the night with no surprises. I liked my short stay at the hotel but next time in NY I may choose another option since there are plenty to try at the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Views! Escape the busy-ness of Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: Julie_PwMS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Park View King Deluxe Oversize room for 7 nights in early April - 12th floor. The views were great even from this level. And the windows opened! Great for fresh air and taking photos. Walking distance to lots of great attractions and a very short walk to 4 subway stations to get everywhere else. The walks through Central Park to Museum of Natural History and Central Park Zoo were relaxing and scenic. Breakfast selection was sub-standard, but that didn't matter with so many alternatives within a short walk - Sarabeth's (next door, approx $45 for 2, but worth it), Fresh & Co (cheap, fresh - 57th St between Fifth & Sixth). The noise level at night was lower than expected - probably helped by the Park opposite rather than buildings. We didn't have much interaction with staff, but we found them to be available and helpful. Central Park Carriage rides and Hop On Hop Off buses both located conveniently on the Central park side of the road. It was a great way to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Room with stunning view!!!”
Reviews.Author: gsj205
Reviews.Content: Book a room on this hotel with central park view and get one of the most impressive views in new York. Stunning and breathtaking.... Good large and spacious rooms. Very cosy, almost like a private room. Bit old style. The minibar was a joke. Old stuff and look out: you are most likely to get billed for unused goods. 4/5 colleagues had this experience. They changed it without question but it looked suspicious! Restaurant breakfast staff a bit uptight and arrogant, not showing attention. Breakfast ok. No tea/coffee in the room. No free wireless Internet. That's really bad service on this level and price range. BUT: location, view and atmosphere was second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Entirely Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Tessa12300
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! A nice and quiet sleeping environment (which is perfect when you're out busy in the city all day!) Room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. A much cheaper alternative to noisier hotels in Times Square, but still located close to all the main attractions. Overall, a wonderful trip. I am booking to return with my boyfriend later in the year, that's how good it was!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but ........”
Reviews.Author: TheBennys
Reviews.Content: There was a lot of mixed reviews i thought about this hotel so here is what i thought, Rooms size was perfect for a city hotel. Room/ bathroom was very clean. Bed very comfortable. Mini Bar very expensive. Hotel Bar very nice decor but overpriced for drink. No turn down service in the evening even though it is listed as one of the services. No real atmosphere in the hotel. The view from my room, lets just say i have never seen so many side profiles of other buildings, I guess not all rooms can have good view, we just had zero views. The hotel is a little over priced I think but the location is obviously the hotels best asset.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms and view!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCrandy
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel and it made our holiday to New York even better! The staff were exceptionally helpful and welcoming, and they upgraded us to a King Deluxe Park View when they found out it was my birthday. The room was huge and the view fantastic! The room was lovely and clean and the bed was really comfy too! The only thing was that the internet was quite expensive ($10 per day) - but the Apple shop is a minute walk away which has free wifi! The location of this hotel is really excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and service from a different era”
Reviews.Author: Stinkyweaslecat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week for my birthday - amazing view over Central Park from 32nd floor. Service was fantastic and from a different age - both myself and my husband felt nothing was too much trouble for all the staff. Would highly recommend to anyone who wants to stay somewhere special right at the heart of the city - can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “amazing views and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nim10
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here in the summer. We had a large room with an amazing view of Central Park (Park View double). This hotel is more about the location than about luxury, which exactly suited us. The staff was amazingly nice and helpful especially Mr. Leung who helped during the initial reservation. In short highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Thodin
Reviews.Content: Had been recomended the Helmsley by colleques, and was looking forward to stay at the hotel just next to Central Park in NY. The location is great, next to Central Park, subway and Fifth Avenue shopping, rooms are clean, not that big and the service ok, breakfast expensive and not good and the service at the breakfastroom is poor, and overall I find the hotel overrated and compared to the price they are charging you for the room there are several better options situated just as great in NY, even to a much better rate, so for me this hotel is a been there, done that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back!”
Reviews.Author: FoodieLondon55
Reviews.Content: The staff at reception were helpful but the concierge were very rude and unhelpful always waiting for tips when they didn't really help with anything. On our last day we took the bags down to concierge they didn't even ask us if we wanted help just stood around doing nothing watching us! then we had left the bags with them when we were ready to leave the concierge bought over the bags in the trolley and just stood there we had to take the bags off the trolley then waited around for a tip! i'm so glad i only gave two dollars would have been happy to give more if they were polite and did their job! For that reason would not go back. The rooms were ok nothing fantastic i'm sure you can get cleaner hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely glorious”
Reviews.Author: suddenlysim
Reviews.Content: My companion and I stayed there from 16 feb to 20 feb and it was absolutely wonderful. when we arrived we were told about an upgrade and we took it and got on the 44th floor. Even though it was a city view, it was just beautiful. The room was extremely clean and beautiful. The service was good from front desk (Americo the receptionist) to room service, to bar attendants to maid service. even the security late at night was very friendly. The location cannot be beat at all. Food could have been a little tastier but it was not that bad. Will recommend and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect view ive ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: Daws78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in Feb. The lady who worked on the desk (brunette) on 19th Feb was excellent - she offered a great room with an amazing view over central park on the 20th floor. I have stayed in NYC before and the value for the view in this hotel was wonderful. The reception area is modest, but dont judge the hotel on this as you dont spend most of your time in the reception area! We had breakfast one morning in the restaurant with a view over-looking a snow-filled central park, wonderful. The rooms were clean with huge beds and they were very comfy. The location was good as nr the key avenues, good for walks in central park, and nr the museums. Subway nearby also. The only downside was the noise from the street - but as one famous person said, the one thing they would never change about the city is the noise! It is what it is, so embrace it! ps Set your alarm early and watch the sun-rise over central park, 1st class experience.

Reviews.Title: “so disappointed.....”
Reviews.Author: plumbob07
Reviews.Content: this was a trip to celebrate big birthday and big anniversary......the first room we were offered was awful.the window was so dirty you couldn't see out, this turned out to be a blessing as it overlooked industriall flues. after a rangle with the receptionist we were given another room, this was very cold and took ages to warm up. Our last morning there we had builders drilling and banging in the rooms next to us from 8.00am. only good thing about hotel, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic beds”
Reviews.Author: Fussyjay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for seven nights, it has to be said that the beds are fantastically comfortable. Also the linen is good, the quilts are down, the thread count is high. Negatives were the check in was very poor, also when you return to the hotel each time you are greeted by a sea of miserable faces, this is so much more noticeable in NYC as customer service is so high. The other big negative is that the hotel is tired , its all just a little shabby and dated, the areas that have been renovated are painted over rather than stripped back. Having said that the rooms are an excellent size, large by any standard, especially Manhattan. Bathrooms are small and more tired. We had a deluxe room, the lowest standard I think, we had a fantastic view, we requested the highest available room on check in, the heating is noisey but for me this is good as it is a constant noise and blocks out the city and hotel noise. Abundant supply of toiletries and towels. Even with the negatives it was a good base, the bed cancels all the negatives, what's a hotel room for but a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable view of Central Park, but hotel is dated.”
Reviews.Author: BatonRougewanderer
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a wonderful view of Central Park that is affordable, then this hotel has what you are looking for. My recommendation is to pay the additional fee to have a view of the Park. You will not be disappointed, especially if you are on a higher floor. Additionally, if you are looking for a large room (by New York City standards), this hotel has what you are looking for. This hotel is within walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and 5th Avenue shopping. If you looking for a hotel that has been updated in the last 20 years, this is not the hotel for you. Every sheet of forest green wallpaper (which was above bright pink wall paper) in my room was peeling at the seam. The bathroom contained the original fixtures from when the hotel was constructed. The room was reasonable clean, though. So, if you do not plan to spend much time in your room (and who does if they are in New York City), this hotel should be a good option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for tired feet!!”
Reviews.Author: DebMet
Reviews.Content: As everybody says you can't be anything but impressed with the location of the hotel, my friend & I stayed at the Helmsley from 9th - 16th Dec and would have no qualms whatsoever about staying there again! We found the room very clean & spacious and the maids knocked on everynight to ask if we wanted the beds turning down - we were usually already in them exausted from walking all day!! The staff, when we needed them were all friendly. We didn't use the hotel's restaurant as it was pretty expensive but you are surrounded by dozens of eateries as soon as you walk out of the front door - we went to the world famous Carnegies (7th & 55th) a few times - MASSIVE portions & very reasonable prices. The only negatives about our stay was the cost of phone calls - I called home (Manchester) twice for about 4 mins each time & i was charged Â£36!! also when we checked out the hotel tried to charge me for Â£20 worth of goods out of the mini bar which we never touched - but the receptionist took the charge off straight away when i told her we hadn't had anything. All in all i would recommend the hotel to anyone and would stay there again in a flash!!

Reviews.Title: “staying at hotel at chiristmas”
Reviews.Author: modular6
Reviews.Content: i was there for a week we didnt have any bother there i will go back next december if i get a good pricethe room where clean the staff and the cleaners we tipped them well as the job they done they deserve it we ate out but we enjoyed every min of our holiday look forward to seeing you all again and we are glad we met some lovely people there so again we hope to see you soon mrs carol walton

Reviews.Title: “Helmsley Park Lane Robbery”
Reviews.Author: JosephImparato
Reviews.Content: Leave your valuables at home if you are planning a stay at The Helmsley Park Lane Hotel in New York. My daughter's money and jewelry were stolen from the room safe over the weekend. NYPD have suggested that it was likely an inside job but the hotel management are tight lipped and do not accept responsability for their guests belongings. Too bad as we have stayed there every year for more than twenty years but will obviously never go back

Reviews.Title: “Fifth but last stay in this well located hÃ´tel but in bad condition”
Reviews.Author: PhilippeDouvier
Reviews.Content: 1998,2002,2006,2009 and 2010. The view on Central Park always guides my choice when I stay in New-York. Helmsley has it. But minuscule and ruined bathrooms are in horrible condition. The room also is in bad condition, bed is far from the fantastic US bedding. Heathing needed to be on maximum to warm the room because the poor condition of the windows and on the 22th floor it was clearly noisy (59th street), also because the poor condition of the windows, so we did sleep with ear plots... BUT we were pleased with the view on the park and the price we paid for it. So, with a coat, a pair of ear plots and no need of a bathroom, Helmsley Park Lane is a good choice. There was a problem with our reservation and during it was on progres to be solved (it did) the reception manager let us in the lobby for 90 minutes without even a glas of water. Not very warm behaviour to a guest who stayed four time before...Next time, back toThe Plaza or to The Jumeirah Essex House, both also on the 59th street !!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, hotel needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Chippy68
Reviews.Content: Opposite Central Park and easy access to Downtown Manhattan. I can not believe that this hotel is part of the Leading Hotels of the World; needs refurbishment and to me this is not a luxury hotel whatsoever; by the way, I stayed in 22nd floor and you can still hear the traffic. Good side: if you get a park view room you won't be disappointed with it, really nice. Bathrooms are old, this is not acceptable from a hotel that pretends to be luxury.If you are looking for location, this hotel has got it, however, if you are looking for luxury do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & the best sleep we've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: DinnyDave
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right accross the road from Central Park and only a 5 minute walk from the madness of Time Square. My wife & I spent 4 nights at this hotel and we were very pleased, especially with how comfy the bed was and I honestly don't think we have had a better sleep whilst on holiday ever! Especially after spending day after day walking miles. The reception area is a little bit cramped and busy at times, however, I think most NY hotels are the same. We looked around for quite a while at different hotels on the internet before booking and alot of the rooms seemed very small, however, at this hotel, they are really quite spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Previous guest's diarrhea: An experience I will never forget”
Reviews.Author: ii2109
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Helmsley Park Lane during the nights of October 13th, 14th and 15th. I had a small problem (well, not so small for a hotel like this...) in my first night: I found pieces of hair in the bathroom (from the previous guest, I presume). I asked for a change of room the following morning and the manager told me that the night of the 14th I would enjoy a nicer room in an upper section of the building (kind of compensating the bad experience I suffered the previous night). That night I came back quite late from my meetings (around 9:30pm), I asked for the number of my new room and both the lady who took care of me at reception and the manager looked quite doubtful (it looked like if nobody knew or had made the change for me). After waiting for too long (it was already 10pm or so), I was taken to my new room, which was actually, if anything, the same quality as the previous one; but not getting the type of room I was supposed to get was not a big deal at that moment. It was quite late, I had an important meeting early the following morning and I just wanted to go to bed. My biggest (and horrendous surprise) came when I went to the bathroom and opened up the toilet seat. If you take a look at the photographs I have posted, you will see the new surprise I got, but this time so much worse than before (I do not need being a doctor to know that the previous guest had diarrhea...). I immediately called reception to ask for a change of room and I even started calling other hotels, as this was already too much. But the unbelievable attitude of the manager in duty (not a single "I am really sorry") would make my night even harder: it took him more than one hour before he changed me to another room. The lady at reception had better manners than the manager (although it should be the opposite, I guess). She apologized several times and promised they would do everything possible to make sure I will have a nice time for the rest of my stay, but she actually didnâ€™t deliver: she left her shift without resolving the issue, leaving me waiting in the room, and I would not get a new one until around 11:30. I finally got a third room (three rooms in three nights), where I did not have any further bad surprise, but what definitely struck me was that neither the manager on duty in my first night, nor the one in my second night nor the one on duty in the morning when I checked out clearly apologized for what had happened (they seemed not to bother!). One of them expressed a shy â€œsorryâ€�, and the one on duty the day I checked out actually did not even apologize (!) In summary, the quality of the managersâ€™ manners in this hotel is definitely comparable to the cleanliness of its bathrooms. I believe the hotel senior management would do themselves a big favor if they reconsider the quality of the management they hire for key positions going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, perfect location, incredible bed and comforter”
Reviews.Author: indyslf
Reviews.Content: I slept like a baby here, which is saying something, because I typically have difficulty with noise or light in most hotels. The down comforter may have helped. It was incredible; reminded me very much of the comforters I love so much in Germany. The room was furnished in an older, upscale Victorian manner. (I think it's Victorian; am not a designer.) The dressers had lots of curled ornamentation, for instance. It felt like a room from a posh, older hotel in Europe. I enjoyed the peace and quite very much. Even the lobby was very sedate. The location is the best: right on the park, almost right next door to a discreet subway entrance. (You have to look for it; it won't jump out at you; at least it didn't for me.) I used the business center a couple of times, and it was very nice. The business center allows people to print out airline boarding tickets for free, which I thought was pretty decent. I had to pay, however, because I used the center for work; I can't remember the price, but it was negligible--about $9 for checking and responding to email, printing out a map, etc. I also enjoyed Sarabeth's next door. I love their breakfasts and enjoyed sitting on the patio looking out at the park. Probably because of the location, the Park Lane's regular rates are very steep. I was in New York for business, though, so received a discounted, corporate price of $270 a night. I don't think I would be able to afford the regular price, which I believe is closer to $400 or $500. For $270, you can't do better in Manhattan. I was thrilled and was able to walk (or use the subway) to get everywhere I wanted. If I'm able to save my pennies, I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable views over Central Park, rooms being refurbished”
Reviews.Author: eertpit
Reviews.Content: We've used this hotel several times now and just love it. It's not the most plush hotel you'll ever use but the Central Park views are unbeatable, truly awesome. Be sure that you don't get switched to a city view which I'm sure is wonderful but misses the point of this hotel - sleep with the curtains open and watch the sun rise over the whole of Central Park with views of both West and East Sides. We got upgraded, junior suite and suite, the latter being a big bedroom and a lounge. Embarrassingly big for one night but perfect for staying longer. Breakfast is a joke, Tiptree jam and decent omelettes but the service is simply dreadful, enjoyable if you've time to watch. We saw a whole breakfast dropped on the floor and left for ages, a couple ask twice to be served before giving up and leaving, poorly trained staff. When we left, we weren't inclined to leave a tip but the waiter who although a bit slow had been sharp enough to scribble a suggested 15% tip on the bill came back and said we'd missed it so he'd write it in for us. $30 for an omelette and one cup of coffee, plus tip. Harry's Bar is ok, some of the staff are really professional, some want to kick you out dead on 12:30. Good atmosphere in the early evening. Whatever the pitfalls (breakfast around the block at Angela's Diner is cheap and they will play The Doors for you), stay here when you're visiting New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Matt01x
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located next to the Central Park and therewith right in the centre of vibrant Manhattan! 5th Avenue was just some metres away and you could easily reach the theatre district (midtown) by foot. The room was spacious and very well decorated. The view from the window was just amazing and so I would highly recommend anyone who wants to visit New York to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and very comfotable bed.”
Reviews.Author: perfectpillow
Reviews.Content: We spent tree nights in this hotel. Loved the location, literally opposite Central Park. The room was a reasonable size and the bed was very comfortable indeed with excellent pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: billsinc
Reviews.Content: After looking at my photos of this hotel my impression improved, it looks better now than it did when we were there. Going for it this hotel, it is in a very good location sitting right opposite Central Park. Getting around is very easy. If you like walking the Times square area is not too far but if not there is a sub-way station between the Helmsley and the Plaza (the hotel from film Home Alone 2). There is another subway station just along the road on 6th Avenue. You can get 1 day fun pass ticket for the subway for $8.25. There are machines in all the subway stations. http://www.mta.info/metrocard/mcgtreng.htm#oneday In addition Graysline tour buses stop outside Central park just along from the hotel and across the road. It was a bit annoying on the bus tour, they made us get off to get on another one, Iâ€™m guessing this is a method they try to use to get more tips for the tour guides. The room was a reasonable size, staff at reception were good and helpful, and the place was clean. However there are some bad points: â€¢ The decoration is not nice. It looks old, it was like being a fish trapped in a fishing net; â€¢ The view. We were on the 19th floor with a view of the backs of other buildings, despite being told by the travel agent it had great views; â€¢ The furniture, not in a great state of repair, well past itâ€™s useful life; â€¢ No tea/coffee making facilities; â€¢ Breakfast in the hotel is $30 plus. (A good breakfast $14 for two just a couple of hundred yards from the hotel on 6th Avenue. http://www.pizzavillagiocafe.com/menu/menu.php ); â€¢ Our bill had a charge for food and beverages we never had from the room. Apparently if you even lift something from their tray it auto charges, We were aware of this and didnâ€™t touch anything, but still got charges, there was no difficulty in having this removed from our bill, it is a bit of a nuisance though; â€¢ The concierge was not very interested, thankfully the Bellhop was much more courteous. The location might entice me to staying here again, maybe it will have been redecorated by then. Tipping in New York is a big deal, they seem to expect 15 -20%. Itâ€™s worth taking that into account when budgeting for your visit, it adds a fair bit when you mount it up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic room, lovely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: marigold5Basingstoke
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay in NYC. Loved the location of this hotel. The room was a lovely size and the bed was so comfortable. The decor is quaintly old fashioned but added to the ambiance. My only criticism if I had one is the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room, if this had been there it would have been perfect. Overall a lovely hotel and fantastic trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “right on central park”
Reviews.Author: balticbash
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, right on Central Park South, excellent spot for reaching anywhere in Manhattan. Should you decide to take hotel breakfast, not included in price, it will set you back around $30 a day, including tip, so if you are on a tight budget, hit the streets. Business Center available, but costs $20 per hour!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: WearyTraveler2005
Reviews.Content: It's hard to beat the view from this hotel - my room looked out over the corner of Central Park and the Columbus Circle. If I were to buy an apartment with this view, I would have spent several million dollars - perhaps that justifies the ridiculous room rate at the hotel. The Park Lane's lobby is nothing terribly noteworthy. When I was in the elevator bank, I heard the desk attendant yelling at someone on the phone about the need to speak English, which seems a bit odd for a hotel of this caliber. Perhaps a more friendly approach or (gasp) a multilingual staff would help. Not to berate the staff, though, because everyone was very friendly to me (I guess I speak English?). For example, the concierge quickly suggested and made reservations at a nearby restaurant when we asked for help. My room on the 38th floor was adequate in decor. Furniture is sort of mid-80s luxury - lots of gilt, flouncy chairs and prints. Kind of like a suburban raised ranch owned by your great aunt. Of course, for the price of this room, couldn't they afford to update? The towels and sheets are wonderful, though, and the bed was quite comfortable. This is an "executive floor" which not only gives you a high floor, but internet access with your printed chairs. The in-room service made me conclude that the Park Lane is actually inhabited by magic fairies - use a towel, and suddenly a new one appears. Turn your back, and suddenly your slippers are placed beside your bed upon a small mat with the words "good morning" written on it. How did they do that? I never once saw a housekeeper in the hall - how did they get to my room? The hotel provided free continental breakfast in the dining room, which was nice, but didn't really rival a Holiday Inn Express in terms of quality. Similary, dinner at the hotel was...OK...but not great. Once again, the view was nice but the pricey chicken breast was nothing but that. The conference facilities are shameful. Really. Dreary, dusty looking rooms with giant mirrors(!) in the shape of interlaced diamond patterns (!) hanging on the wall and strange mid 80's chandeliers do not say "luxury hotel". On the upside, the food at the conference was better than the dining room. An odd final note - cabs seemed unaware that the Park Lane exists. Whenever we asked to be taken to the hotel, the driver needed help finding it. Hmm...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect comfort, old school glamour and impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: little_wing123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Right on Park Lane, opposite Central Park, the location is perfect. The rooms are large, beautifully furnished, with the most comfortable beds any of us had ever slept in. I'm still dreaming of that bed! It's a hotel that would suit everyone. i would certainly go back for a romantic break or a trip with friends. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Old School Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Mystycka
Reviews.Content: I think we brought the classiness of the hotel down while we were there, but we enjoyed our Park View King for the incredible view. The room was very spacious and the cleaning staff were impeccable. We had a deal for the room - I'm not sure I could justify the rack rate - and considered it a good visit. The exercise facilities are great and while the business centre has costs associated for use, it was nice to be able to print what we needed. Internet access was good, but I would expect that when I'm paying a premium for it. Location is key for this hotel - easy access to lots of shopping, short walk to subways, easy to get a taxi and of course, perfect for central park & museum visits! Overall, a great first trip to New York - I'm glad we were able to visit two different hotels and get the most of each. This was a great way to end our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room fab views”
Reviews.Author: passarinho
Reviews.Content: Had deluxe junior suite on 30th floor overlooking central park- all we can say is Wow! Must be one of the best views in the City. Ate out so can't comment on any other facilities but the room and view is worth five stars. Beautiful room nicely decorated in an older style but very comfortable feel to it. If you go to NY and want a good room with brilliant view-go to the Helmsley Park Lane

Reviews.Title: “Ok so the hotel needs a refresh but look...”
Reviews.Author: Ecossebdr
Reviews.Content: Ok so the hotel needs a refresh but look past that and it's good value for money if you push hard for a deal. Location cannot be beaten. For breakfast head to the Green Cafe out the back door and to the left.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed for one night and it was great!”
Reviews.Author: Dahlin2
Reviews.Content: Perfect location...none better for Nyc in a nutshell...

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel in immaculate spot!”
Reviews.Author: MinniMari
Reviews.Content: It does not get any better. We came from Finland from Scandinavia just for the long weekend and Park Lane offered us everything we needed and even more. Travelled all around the world, this hotel impressed with many, many things. Breakfast staff was classy with manners, Conciers were ever so helpful, taxis, even horserides, were always available in front of the hotel, etc. It was so easy to pop in to Central park in the morning or walk back from Broadway`s musicals, everything was so close. Open bus stop was in front of the hotel, you could travel all way around Manhattan or use it just for cool transportation. The rooms were spacy and with view I will ever forget. Laundry service was mentionable quick and the newspaper in front of the door added just that little convinience, that you are after from your holiday. Splendid hotel in immaculate spot. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Practicaltraveler4
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - can't beat the location. Staff was friendly and helpful. We were on the 18th floor -- yes, the facility can use some love, but it was clean and spacious. One of the most comfortable beds we've slept on in a hotel. The entire floor was non-smoking, and the halls were wonderfully quiet. Based on other reviews we've read, we were concerned about, but we were more than satisfied with the Park Lane.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, made our holiday special.”
Reviews.Author: lark82
Reviews.Content: Travelled to New York for 2 weeks for my partners birthday, had a room on the 21st floor really well decorated clean, tidy and really spacious. My partner has a health condition and I had requested a refrigerator on the room when booking, was all there when we checked in so no problems. Staff were really friendly and helpful, advised us on local places to eat, restaurant at the hotel is very pricey but you can eat lovely meals at the Sixth Avenue diner round the corner. We were also advised but a really helpful member of staff about tennis that was happening, he said he would look into how to get there and times and would get back to us, we went out for the whole day and when we came back in the evening had post that he had left for us. Rooms were cleaned and fresh towels given everyday, however there was supposed to be a turndown service but in the 2 weeks this only happened once, but to be honest that does not matter to me too much. Complimentary New York Times left on your door handle every morning was a lovely touch too. Subway station a 2 minute walk from the front of the hotel making it accessible to all popoular tourist destinations within 10 minutes. Subway system was easy to follow and would recommend a 1 week metrocard which at the time cost us $25. Location of the Hotel made it easy to walk around Central Park and visit the American Museum of Natural History, Dakota Building and Strawberry Fields, Times square is also only a 15-20 minute walk as well. Duane Reed store in sixth avenue means you can stock up on cheap drinks and snacks for your room at a very low price as well. Only negatives to our stay, it was not made clear that we had to leave a credit card for deposit, as neither me or my partner had one we had to leave $200 each which we had to take from our spending money leaving us short for our holiday, we did get this back at checkout but spending $200 on our last day proved difficult when we only had a couple of hours before our flight. So make sure you either have a Credit Card or take some extra cash with you. Also the minibar in the room had a note on to say that it was motion sensored, we did not use the mini bar as the prices were very expensive but did on checkout get a bill for items on there, I queried this with reception and advised that we did not use it and the bill was cancelled. I would stay at this hotel again and recommend to everyone, however we did stay here for a special birthday so if your on a budget this could be a bit on the pricey side but well worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: babsp123
Reviews.Content: I do not understand the positive reviews given to this hotel. The ONLY positive point is the perfect location right in front of Central Park. Everything else is a shame: - Front desk: incompetent and certainly not in line with the standard that the hotel would like to have. Except for one young lady that was always smiling and at least trying to be helpful. - No help to be expected when carrying your luggage as the bell boys are busier talking to each other or reading news papers... - Rooms are outdated, dusty and hairs are found everywhere in the bathroom. I stayed in 2 different rooms, in both there were problems with the bathroom appliances that no one took care of. - Probably the worst experience is the breakfast. It seems more like some kind of cafeteria. The waiter are at the edge of being disrespectful. And the food is not much better. We tried only once, and then went to the nearby coffee place called FIKA (highly recommended). - Internet is not free of charge Simply pass your way and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in NYC - Central Park view was amazing !!!”
Reviews.Author: Nojaim
Reviews.Content: My brother and I met in NYC for a long weekend and had the best time at the Helmsley. Everyone on the staff was fantastic! The park view rooms are amazing and the king size bed and pillows were so comfortable. The location is perfect - we were a few blocks away from some of the best restaurants in NYC and the entrance to Central Park was directly across the street. I would highly recommend the Helmsley to anyone traveling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: Marcia7575
Reviews.Content: My husband's work chose this hotel, and while it was a great location (across the street from Central Park and next door to the Plaza) it was horrible. Everything was old and dated. The room was small with only a double bed (we were told this was the largest bed they have in the hotel) and the heat could not be turned off so we opened the window in a rainstorm to get air. When we arrived, the two doormen could not be bothered to even greet us because they were chatting with another guest. However, the bellman who showed us to our room was old school and was gracious, kind and very pleasant. Being on Central Park South next to the Plaza does not make staying at this hotel worth it, and it was free for me!

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: lufc04
Reviews.Content: Just bac 4rm our honeymoon in new york and thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the hotel .For location its great with central park accross the street and time square only a 10 minute walk away .Like other reviews we were given a hefty mini bar bill but when we told them we never touched it <u will understand if u see the pricce list>she said no problem and tore it up infront of us .would i go bac definitly

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Heather029
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Helmsley Park Lane with a friend for 4 nights May 20-24, 2010. The room had been booked through a travel agent requesting 2 beds but when we arrived, were told that our room had a king bed in it and if we wanted 2 beds, it would be more expensive. We decided to keep the king bed room. We were not facing central park but our room was very clean and quiet to sleep. The location was excellent with the park across the street as well as very close subway stops and the hop on / hop off tourist bus right across the street. The first morning we ate breakfast in the elegant dining room - it was delicious and the staff very friendly but breakfast for 2 was $60.00,. We discovered if you went out the back entrance of the hotel, there was a lovely cafe ( The Green Cafe) that sold breakfast and lunch food - all very fresh, delicious and inexpensive s well as juices, water etc to take for the day. Overall. I would recommend this hotel for the location and cleanliness but found the front desk staff could have been more helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best NY Hotels. Great location, Great service - not the cheapest.”
Reviews.Author: CandidReviewer444
Reviews.Content: First stay in NY. Helmsley Park Lane Hotel is ideally situated for sightseeing, shopping, shows etc and quite grand, if ever so slightly tired - but nothing to worry about. Best rooms are at the front overlooking Central Park, sadly we were at the back! Difficult to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but not my type of place”
Reviews.Author: BandiB
Reviews.Content: Must start off by saying that this hotel was chosen by a client and would not have been my first choice. Location is great for the city, 1 minute to the subway and across from Central Park. Room was fine and comfy though some things were a little dated. Only ate one breakfast in the hotel which was very expensive and distincly average. Service was OK but I came away feeling that this hotel used or was trying to be something it isn't - ie a top class hotel. It certainly is not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fitzpap3
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location, it looks right onto central park and is within walking diatance of all the main attractions Staff all very friendly. The rooms are all spacious and clean. Overall a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but glad i got a cheap deal!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Flameboyf42
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a fantastic 3night honeymoon in New York, we opted for the Helmsley for its great location and because it was 4.5stars and seemed to be on a fantastic offer (was priced the same as other 3star hotels in New York). In reality it was just a bed for each night as we made the most of our first visit to NY. The room was a good size, clean and the bed was very comfortable! but parts of the hotel looked tired and a bit tatty. The snack/drink bar that was governed by a weight sensor and was thick with dust (i dread to think what price things were!) As with other reviews I have read for this hotel we too were charged for using the mini bar/snack/drink bar when we had not! It was not a nice feeling going to reception to say we hadn't, it really took the edge off our last day in NY, fortunately they removed the charge without any arguement. We never ate or drank in the hotel so cannot comment, we loved the location right on central park.
